commit_message:
[WIP] Fix fluentd outputter

Something inside of the Instance() object is breaking serialization
downstream in the fluentd code. Attempting to isolate and resolve that
issue.

Change-Id: Ifc4669fb2868f273b1852312775e69d1cce2c70e
Closes-Bug: #1782361

subject: Log in UTC time by default to prevent ambiguity
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 8099, 'name': 'Graham Hayes', 'email': 'gr@ham.ie', 'username': 'graham'}, {'_account_id': 9107, 'name': 'Victor Stinner', 'email': 'vstinner@redhat.com', 'username': 'haypo'}, {'_account_id': 11752, 'name': 'Alex Barclay', 'email': 'alex@planet-barclay.com', 'username': 'barclaac'}, {'_account_id': 16051, 'name': 'Ronald Bradford', 'email': 'ronald.bradford@gmail.com', 'username': 'ronaldbradford'}, {'_account_id': 16962, 'name': 'Federico Ceratto', 'email': 'federico.ceratto@gmail.com', 'username': 'ceratto'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 16962, 'date': '2016-01-20 13:04:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-01-20 14:45:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-oslo.log-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/78/270178/1/check/gate-oslo.log-pep8/bcee83f/ : SUCCESS in 58s
- gate-oslo.log-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/78/270178/1/check/gate-oslo.log-docs/84233cd//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 36s
- gate-oslo.log-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/78/270178/1/check/gate-oslo.log-python27/8dd78e7/ : SUCCESS in 1m 06s
- gate-oslo.log-python34 http://logs.openstack.org/78/270178/1/check/gate-oslo.log-python34/fb1fc8f/ : SUCCESS in 1m 13s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.log http://logs.openstack.org/78/270178/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.log/b6bd87a/ : SUCCESS in 1h 33m 10s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.log-liberty http://logs.openstack.org/78/270178/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.log-liberty/45eeef6/ : FAILURE in 20m 20s (non-voting)
- gate-tempest-dsvm-largeops-src-oslo.log http://logs.openstack.org/78/270178/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-largeops-src-oslo.log/9958f90/ : SUCCESS in 44m 07s'}, {'account_id': 16962, 'date': '2016-01-20 16:05:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

**WARNING** Please be aware that this commit changes the default behavior of the library and this will likely affect various OpenStack products that are currently logging in local time.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2016-01-20 18:04:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

As this stands now it is not backwards compatible (hence the -2). The option should at least be set so that the current behavior is retained by default. We can discuss a transition period for changing the behavior to default to UTC separately.

That said, I don't think we need this at all. If the correct time zone for the service process is set when it is launched, the current code does the right thing, doesn't it?"}, {'account_id': 11752, 'date': '2016-01-21 18:09:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I really like the idea of this patch. I generally have my machines timezone set to its physical location but if I run multiple regions in multiple timezones my logs won't line up. This fixes that because I can then do direct comparison. So I disagree with Doug on this bit.

I agree with Doug that we shouldn't change the default because people are likely relying on the behavior.

If we change the default to use_local_timezone to be True then I'll change my vote to a +1"}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2016-01-22 19:38:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

what we could do is change the default back to True, then use http://docs.openstack.org/developer/debtcollector/examples.html#changing-the-default-value-of-a-keyword-argument to indicate that in the future we are going to change the default.

but ++ on the patch in general - we should definitely allow this.'}, {'account_id': 16962, 'date': '2016-01-27 18:45:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16962, 'date': '2016-01-27 19:00:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Code update to to retain the old behavior while generating a warning if needed.

In future the code could be updated to deprecate the use of local time altogether and later on use UTC as default.

Graham: the updating function generates a potentially misleading message "please update the code to explicitly set True as the value" while users might want to update a configuration file (or switch to UTC)

Doug: the current code can log only using the local time. The local time is generated dynamically from the system time based on a system-wide configuration. The offset between local time and system can change e.g. due to daylight saving time or the administrators changing the system time zone.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2016-01-27 19:10:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Federico, all you have to do is set the TZ variable for the process to "UTC".

  $ python -c 'import time; print time.localtime()'
  time.struct_time(tm_year=2016, tm_mon=1, tm_mday=27, tm_hour=14, tm_min=8, tm_sec=36, tm_wday=2, tm_yday=27, tm_isdst=0)

Because my timezone is normally set to US/Eastern, the time jumps 5 hours ahead when I set TZ to UTC.

  $ TZ=UTC python -c 'import time; print time.localtime()'
  time.struct_time(tm_year=2016, tm_mon=1, tm_mday=27, tm_hour=19, tm_min=8, tm_sec=39, tm_wday=2, tm_yday=27, tm_isdst=0)

That variable can be set in a startup script for the service, without affecting the "global" setting for the server.'}, {'account_id': 11752, 'date': '2016-01-27 19:45:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I couldn't disagree with you more Doug. What you're proposing is an  poor solution because I'll now have different ways to enable this functionality depending on the distribution. We should be thinking about this not from the "just put a TZ=" in front of the program but rather in terms of how we get people using Redhat or Ubuntu distributions who want to deploy this at scale. Putting this into the code allows for a standardized place for this configuration element and prevents one-off solutions for every cloud.'}, {'account_id': 16051, 'date': '2016-01-27 20:24:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Federico,

What is the use case that requires you force all logging to be in UTC time?

I am not familiar with any other running software on servers that force this by default.  Generally if you want to ensure consistency you set the server's time to UTC and all services across all log files are then consistent.

I would suggest that if you want to introduce a new feature and to maintain backward compatibility, you can add a new "Log in UTC time" option.  This enables operators to determine when upgrading if they are ready for this change, especially if they also need to reconfigure any centralized logging system already in use.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-01-27 21:08:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-oslo.log-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/78/270178/2/check/gate-oslo.log-pep8/74a81d6/ : SUCCESS in 56s
- gate-oslo.log-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/78/270178/2/check/gate-oslo.log-docs/604cff9//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 05s
- gate-oslo.log-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/78/270178/2/check/gate-oslo.log-python27/9ea37be/ : SUCCESS in 1m 07s
- gate-oslo.log-python34 http://logs.openstack.org/78/270178/2/check/gate-oslo.log-python34/2b1e010/ : SUCCESS in 1m 20s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.log http://logs.openstack.org/78/270178/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.log/e4410a0/ : SUCCESS in 58m 07s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.log-liberty http://logs.openstack.org/78/270178/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.log-liberty/ec96665/ : FAILURE in 21m 21s (non-voting)
- gate-tempest-dsvm-largeops-src-oslo.log http://logs.openstack.org/78/270178/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-largeops-src-oslo.log/d4b2f90/ : SUCCESS in 39m 08s'}, {'account_id': 11752, 'date': '2016-01-27 23:29:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Ronald, I'm not sure that you saw all of the code. You said, "I would suggest that if you want to introduce a new feature and to maintain backward compatibility, you can add a new "Log in UTC time" option.  This enables operators to determine when upgrading if they are ready for this change, especially if they also need to reconfigure any centralized logging system already in use."

If you look at the change to oslo_log/_options.py you'll see quite clearly that there is a new option to use local time for logging and the default value is true, meaning that there is no change to the default behavior.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2016-01-28 18:55:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

We should move this discussion to the mailing list, to get more input and so it is easier to follow replies. Can someone who is in favor of the change start a new thread with [oslo] in the subject?'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2016-01-29 07:54:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Honestly, I think this approach is pretty suboptimal, logging by programs should be in the same TZ as the system is set to, for the following reason. OpenStack is a set of services, that talk to other services on the same machines. Debugging those interactions (like between OpenStack and mysql, rabbit, syslog) means that those events need to all line up. 

This would artificially line up openstack components across different TZs, however would leave all the system services on a bunch of skews.

Fortunately, there is a solution to this. Set your system time zone to TZ=UTC. Then all components are using the same time zone.

This intermediary solution is something that I've never seen in other Open Source server projects, and violates the principle of least surprise."}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2016-02-16 20:23:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I like the idea of adding *an option* to log in the UTC timezone. -1 for the current implementation which changes the default format.

See also the change Id4754c18935940cc7c738e4a91880267fdeb808f which proposes: "Add ISO8601/RFC3339 timestamp to ContextFormatter".'}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2016-02-29 17:22:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

The mitaka release is in feature freeze and only bug fixes for mitaka will be accepted until a stable branch is created. The -2 will be removed when a stable branch is created.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-03-07 07:30:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

commit_message:
Log in UTC time by default to prevent ambiguity

Raise an exception if the overrides are used to log in local time without
including a timezone or UTC offset

Change-Id: Ia088b0ab8ee39eba92e78a656794ca688efb758d
Related-Bug: 1535683

commit_message:
FluentFormater log http stat. metrics

(WIP - open for review/comments/help)

Most of the API calls contain https statistics that's is common to
track and store in time series db to evaluate backbend performance.

Feature update entry if such common stats are found in the log msg.

Change-Id: I7381aa8c07af68dff612334cf832b23cb1606eed

commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial, now that we have
Bionic Beaver nodes that support python3.7, lets switch to testing with
python3.7 in addition with python3.6 in Stein and beyond.
See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135632.html

Change-Id: I7423d3241ac4195df5926554c1203110c0a56382
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <chucks@redhat.com>
Story: #2004073
Task: #27440

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-15 11:27:39.000000000', 'message': "Stabilize unshelve notification sample tests

The notification sample test for unshelve waits for the instance to
reach ACTIVE state and then asserts if unshelve.end notification is
emitted properly. However the instance.vm_state is set to ACTIVE earlier[1]
than emitting the unshelve.end notification[2]. This can cause two
different test case failure.

1) _test_unshelve_server() fails with no ushelve.end notification
received.

2) _test_shelve_and_shelve_offload_server() also has a unshelve action
at the end and that test step also only waits for the the ACTIVE state.
So the unshelve.end notification from the end of
_test_shelve_and_shelve_offload_server() can bleed into the
_test_unshelve_server() step causing that it receive one more
notifications.

So this patch adds an extra
self._wait_for_notification('instance.unshelve.end') call to each test
step to prevent the instability.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/5c6c1f8f/nova/compute/manager.py#L5322-L5326
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/5c6c1f8f/nova/compute/manager.py#L5329
[3] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/5c6c1f8f/nova/tests/functional/notification_sample_tests/test_instance.py#L836

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/functional/notification_sample_tests/test_instance.py
Conflicts due to:
* Ie7a886f5b389c2f0bb9dc66129e4562cc09ba1b5

Closes-Bug: #1835070

Change-Id: Ie217523a8969326b27930d7f74e50e9b352ab7a1
(cherry picked from commit 40f1e7c4c22dc6023614b34f28bb7fc416b668a8)

(cherry picked from commit 3bc6ff029ff24083844db363010988d8d08cff00)

2) _test_shelve_and_shelve_offload_server() also has a unshelve action

_test_shelve_and_shelve_offload_server() can bleed into the

self._wait_for_notification('instance.unshelve.end') call to each test
step to prevent the instability.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/5c6c1f8f/nova/compute/manager.py#L5322-L5326
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/5c6c1f8f/nova/compute/manager.py#L5329
[3] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/5c6c1f8f/nova/tests/functional/notification_sample_tests/test_instance.py#L836

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/functional/notification_sample_tests/test_instance.py
Conflicts due to:
* Ie7a886f5b389c2f0bb9dc66129e4562cc09ba1b5

Also in pike there is no _test_shelve_and_shelve_offload_server step but
two distinct steps _test_shelve_server and _test_shelve_offload_server so
this patch needed to be extened on pike. In the_test_shelve_server step
we need to wait for instance.power_on.end instead of instance.unshelve.end
as unshelve without offload just powers on the instance.

Closes-Bug: #1835070

Change-Id: Ie217523a8969326b27930d7f74e50e9b352ab7a1
(cherry picked from commit 40f1e7c4c22dc6023614b34f28bb7fc416b668a8)
(cherry picked from commit 3bc6ff029ff24083844db363010988d8d08cff00)
(cherry picked from commit a85ce04fa39e60e672e4fa2d7912f6880079c6ef)
(cherry picked from commit 8afc39a2c748a8fde070493dd5633788f782c69a)
"}]
commit_message:
Stabilize unshelve notification sample tests

The notification sample test for unshelve waits for the instance to
reach ACTIVE state and then asserts if unshelve.end notification is
emitted properly. However the instance.vm_state is set to ACTIVE earlier[1]
than emitting the unshelve.end notification[2]. This can cause two
different test case failure.

1) _test_unshelve_server() fails with no ushelve.end notification
received.

2) _test_shelve_and_shelve_offload_server() also has a unshelve action
at the end and that test step also only waits for the the ACTIVE state.
So the unshelve.end notification from the end of
_test_shelve_and_shelve_offload_server() can bleed into the
_test_unshelve_server() step causing that it receive one more
notifications.

So this patch adds an extra
self._wait_for_notification('instance.unshelve.end') call to each test
step to prevent the instability.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/5c6c1f8f/nova/compute/manager.py#L5322-L5326
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/5c6c1f8f/nova/compute/manager.py#L5329
[3] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/5c6c1f8f/nova/tests/functional/notification_sample_tests/test_instance.py#L836

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/functional/notification_sample_tests/test_instance.py
Conflicts due to:
* Ie7a886f5b389c2f0bb9dc66129e4562cc09ba1b5

Also in pike there is no _test_shelve_and_shelve_offload_server step but
two distinct steps _test_shelve_server and _test_shelve_offload_server so
this patch needed to be extened on pike. In the_test_shelve_server step
we need to wait for instance.power_on.end instead of instance.unshelve.end
as unshelve without offload just powers on the instance.

Closes-Bug: #1835070

Change-Id: Ie217523a8969326b27930d7f74e50e9b352ab7a1
(cherry picked from commit 40f1e7c4c22dc6023614b34f28bb7fc416b668a8)
(cherry picked from commit 3bc6ff029ff24083844db363010988d8d08cff00)
(cherry picked from commit a85ce04fa39e60e672e4fa2d7912f6880079c6ef)
(cherry picked from commit 8afc39a2c748a8fde070493dd5633788f782c69a)

commit_message:
Correct availability_zone to be non-mandatory in heat

As per CLI and GUI, availability_zone is not mandatory.  In templates,
it is.  This is incorrect.

This patch corrects behaviour to match CLI and GUI.

Change-Id: Ice37340f084ea65bd4b46562145e82ede6bc0df5
Story: 2006586
(cherry picked from commit 2799a5fcd76639a202092ea1b6fc242a8886dc56)

[{'created': '2019-12-17 08:12:32.000000000', 'message': 'Allow to use Mellanox smart NICs for DPDK

Previously to run DPDK applications on BM hosts with
SR-IOV functionality it was necessary to rebind virtual
function on some userspace driver (vfio-pci, uio_pci_generic
etc.).

But default Mellanox drivers (mlx4_core, mlx5_core) can work
with DPDK and do not require to be changed to userspace driver.
Moreover there could be occur a problem while trying to change
driver for Mellanox virtual functions.

This patch detects devices with Mellanox default driver in
the kuryr-kubernetes binding process and skip it (do not rebind).

Closes-Bug: 1856663

Signed-off-by: Danil Golov <d.golov@samsung.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to use Mellanox smart NICs for DPDK

Previously to run DPDK applications on BM hosts with
SR-IOV functionality it was necessary to rebind virtual
function on some userspace driver (vfio-pci, uio_pci_generic
etc.).

But default Mellanox drivers (mlx4_core, mlx5_core) can work
with DPDK and do not require to be changed to userspace driver.
Moreover there could be occur a problem while trying to change
driver for Mellanox virtual functions.

This patch detects devices with Mellanox default driver in
the kuryr-kubernetes binding process and skip it (do not rebind).

Closes-Bug: 1856663
Change-Id: Ic5a76a6248a50370690dee2b0d57e2ded944a909
Signed-off-by: Danil Golov <d.golov@samsung.com>

'}, {'created': '2019-12-17 06:52:03.000000000', 'message': 'Use osp_release flag to set selinux mode

In Upstream and rdo-cloud tripleo ci jobs on RHEL & CentOS, we
use selinux mode to permissive but currently it is harded for
CentOS only.

In Downstream jobs, we use enforcing mode. So instead of depending
upon ansible_distribution, we can rely on osp_release to toggle
selinux mode and will work for both centOS and RHEL.

Related-Bug: 1853028

Change-Id: I6a6449777ea28198002b8c028a345ab16b733901
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Use osp_release flag to set selinux mode

In Upstream and rdo-cloud tripleo ci jobs on RHEL & CentOS, we
use selinux mode to permissive but currently it is harded for
CentOS only.

In Downstream jobs, we use enforcing mode. So instead of depending
upon ansible_distribution, we can rely on osp_release to toggle
selinux mode and will work for both centOS and RHEL.

Related-Bug: 1853028

Change-Id: I6a6449777ea28198002b8c028a345ab16b733901
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
deploy-steps: use lookup() to get pre|post_deployments_role variables

Note: this patch is only for Stein and its previous versions.
Train and master are fine.

The syntax in place didn't allow to have an empty default for these 2
vars; which can happen in Queens if config-download is disabled.

Using the lookup module allows to set a default.

Change-Id: I38c658e0b0f2e334bd529fe66f937465036cc205
Closes-Bug: #1856314
(cherry picked from commit 44d2502383bc539287cf42ca488773242ad6be9f)

Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

For more detials information, please refer to:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

[{'account_id': 30495, 'date': '2019-11-25 23:38:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-11-25 23:38:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 30495, 'date': '2019-11-25 23:41:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 30495, 'date': '2019-11-25 23:41:48.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to S2006937'}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2019-11-26 13:39:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Couple of nits, but looks like a good patch.'}, {'account_id': 30495, 'date': '2019-11-26 18:26:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 30495, 'date': '2019-11-26 18:26:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-11-26 19:57:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

As discussed on storyboard, just deleting properties could cause existing stacks to break (they were created and validated with these properties in the template, but now the resource type has no property to match that data - an error that would usually be caught at validation time).

You can hide a property by passing a support_status. Normal practice is to deprecate the property first - since IIUC it has only been deprecated but not removed by Nova that's probably the place to start here.

Here's an example of a deprecated property:

https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/src/branch/master/heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server.py#L588-L598

And here's a hidden one:

https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/src/branch/master/heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server.py#L383-L394"}, {'account_id': 30495, 'date': '2019-11-27 14:32:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Thanks Zane! I will submit a new PS today with a deprecated support_status for the properties'}, {'account_id': 30495, 'date': '2019-11-27 18:21:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 30495, 'date': '2019-11-27 18:22:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 30495, 'date': '2019-12-03 15:13:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Instructions are here: https://docs.openstack.org/reno/latest/user/usage.html'}, {'account_id': 30495, 'date': '2019-12-13 15:51:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 30495, 'date': '2019-12-13 15:52:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Published edit on patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-12-13 20:35:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Deprecate injected_file properties in Nova Quota Resource

The following properties are deprecated in nova and need to be removed
from the nova quota resource.

Corresponding nova PS deprecating properties:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/509013/

Change-Id: If4390977f942087a1012d609186eefc4a624d411

subject: Bump stack.libvirt-vm role to 1.8.0
messages:
[{'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2019-12-13 13:55:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-12-13 14:04:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-12-13 14:05:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I had wondered if we should do a blanket upgrade of galaxy roles. Might be a bit late now.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2019-12-16 10:08:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I had wondered if we should do a blanket upgrade of galaxy roles.
 > Might be a bit late now.

Indeed, it's quite late to bump everything without exercising the new versions on an actual deployment. Maybe bump the ones we can test easily and that we know bring real benefit?"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-12-17 15:46:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-13 13:55:59.000000000', 'message': 'Bump stack.libvirt-vm role to 1.8.0

This version adds the ACPI feature [1] to the guest definition, which
should help to support graceful shutdowns with `virsh shutdown`.

[1] https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-role-libvirt-vm/commit/8405c20cf9b0ce86295b431a0bb07f8814b03f70

Change-Id: I56533ead8357945a42b079fda7edbd9912fc135a
'}]
commit_message:
Bump stack.libvirt-vm role to 1.8.0

This version adds the ACPI feature [1] to the guest definition, which
should help to support graceful shutdowns with `virsh shutdown`.

[1] https://github.com/stackhpc/ansible-role-libvirt-vm/commit/8405c20cf9b0ce86295b431a0bb07f8814b03f70

Change-Id: I56533ead8357945a42b079fda7edbd9912fc135a

Why can this not be incorporated into the current bootstrap job, via enhancing it?'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2019-10-30 16:46:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

It can be included into the bootstrap job, yes. We felt like it was more flexible to have it as a separate optional job. But I can also see why people would hesitate to accept having another startup job in the mix.  Either way, I'm going to have to add a separate container to perform the kubectl commands, and the script is going to have to be customizable  downstream."}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2019-10-31 20:08:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2019-10-31 20:29:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> It can be included into the bootstrap job, yes. We felt like it was
 > more flexible to have it as a separate optional job. But I can also
 > see why people would hesitate to accept having another startup job
 > in the mix.  Either way, I'm going to have to add a separate
 > container to perform the kubectl commands, and the script is going
 > to have to be customizable  downstream.

I think a better approach here would be to just make an init container for the bootstrap job, and have it wait for a percentage of the hosts to be ready before completing. Using an init container here would be cleaner and logically makes sense in this case"}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2019-11-04 14:55:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2019-11-04 19:49:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

[{'created': '2019-10-26 21:22:05.000000000', 'message': 'Add capability to wait on compute nodes

This patchset adds the capability to the Nova chart to be able to wait
for all compute nodes/hypervisors to become ready/available before
continuing on with the deployment. It will be disabled by default,
because this is a feature that may or may not be needed in production
deployments.

Change-Id: I971151a663afc87e7d62efa4ab3723c5472a3736

commit_message:
Add capability to wait on compute nodes

This patchset adds the capability to the Nova chart to be able to wait
for a percentage of the compute nodes/hypervisors to become ready/available
before continuing on with the deployment. It will be disabled by default,
because this is a feature that may or may not be needed in production
deployments.

Change-Id: I971151a663afc87e7d62efa4ab3723c5472a3736

commit_message:
Fix feature gate envvar overriding

Currently using envsubst to perform substitution of value overrides in
the feature gate caused conflicts as gotpl gets templated into those
overrides. This adds in '%%%REPLACE_${var}%%%' and uses sed to perform
the substitution instead to address the issue.

This is to achieve parity with OSH-infra patch in [0].

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697749/

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697749

Change-Id: I3ed504c65900e7b84728019f3acdf706a40c0427
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tlam@omegaprime.dev>

commit a2fda37ce8907c27cb358957602de4aea1db86f8
Author: indicoliteplus <ccyu@fiberhome.com>
Date:   Wed Jun 14 14:34:04 2017 +0800
    Revert "Using assertFalse(A) instead of assertEqual(False, A)"
    This is not correct,
    because assertEqual(False, A) is a stricter check than assertFalse(A).
    assertFalse(None) passes, but assertEqual(False, None) will fail.
    Therefore, this patch weakened our tests.
    Change-Id: I535712a1c56d2e50a4cd7ecd8ca3cdc58eb41f32

commit_message:
Revert "Using assertFalse(A) instead of assertEqual(False, A)"

This is not correct,
because assertEqual(False, A) is a stricter check than assertFalse(A).
assertFalse(None) passes, but assertEqual(False, None) will fail.
Therefore, this patch weakened our tests.

Change-Id: I535712a1c56d2e50a4cd7ecd8ca3cdc58eb41f32

The overall is in a very good shape. 

But I'm still concerned by application that use keystone_auth1 and keystone_middleware, I have already mentioned that in the blueprint. 

For example:

  [keystone_authtoken]
  auth_type = admin_token
  endpoint = foo://nar
  # I don't define the 'required' "token" option

Validator doesn't complain about the missing required option.

Or:

  [keystone_authtoken]
  auth_uri = http://192.168.3.51:5000
  project_domain_name = Default
  project_name = service
  user_domain_name = Default
  password = password
  username = gnocchi
  auth_url = http://192.168.3.51:35357
  auth_type = password

Wrongly tell me: Spelling suggestions: {('keystone_authtoken', 'auth_url'): ['auth_uri']}


The validator don't work for such cases. I really would like to see a solution for this. And I'm ok with only a TODO in the code and a warning that said that some namespace can't be verified (for now). 

Because the the file cannot be verified, we have to tell the user that the 'partially validated' config file is perhaps still invalid.'}, {'account_id': 19611, 'date': '2016-11-09 16:23:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

[keystone_authtoken]
  auth_type = admin_token
  endpoint = foo://nar
  # I don't define the 'required' "token" option

This will be difficult as there are no inter-dependencies in oslo that would signal this: i.e. this option is required if value of this option is x.'}, {'account_id': 19611, 'date': '2016-11-09 16:36:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

My concern have still not been fixed... We can't have validator tools that fail for the keytstone_authtoken issue. And all projects use keytstone_authtoken.

I understand this is hard to fix and I don't ask for a fix here. But we need something to not print the configuration is wrong when this one is not. Perhaps just something to ignore some sections set by default to ['keystone_authtoken']. 

Because many projects have also other credentials session to connect to other services API.
Like [nova] section in neutron.conf, [service_credientials] in ceilometer.conf, etc..."}, {'account_id': 7037, 'date': '2016-12-05 18:04:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 29:

commit_message:
Oslo Validator

Implements the Oslo configuration validator,
If5d3b56c71cb3b916d04d80e77781d9bdd7f3b5c

oslo-config-validator is a utility for validating
config files against a list of namespaces.

Implements: blueprint oslo-validator

Co-Authored-By: Brian Stajkowski <brian.stajkowski@rackspace.com>
Co-Authored-By: ChangBo Guo(gcb) <eric.guo@easystack.cn>

Change-Id: I78d3621afda226f5968963ef408507234dfead4c

subject: Add a "type" target to tox
messages:
[{'account_id': 8122, 'date': '2019-01-27 01:34:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8122, 'date': '2019-01-27 15:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-01-27 15:57:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-01-28 09:03:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Do we just want to add this to pep8? Presumably we want to gate on it or it will most likely break over time.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-01-28 09:55:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Do we just want to add this to pep8? Presumably we want to gate on
 > it or it will most likely break over time.

I think mypy tests look like a bit to bandit checks (in kind of tests)  so it make sense to just add mypy to pep8.

Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-01-28 10:52:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

We probably want to start gating on this, like I did for nova [1]. You could either add a custom job here or to openstack-infra/zuul-jobs or openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539168/'}, {'account_id': 8122, 'date': '2019-01-28 15:38:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-04-02 09:05:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Any news about gating mypy with zuul like Stephen suggested?'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-04-05 14:19:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Any news about gating mypy with zuul like Stephen suggested?

The conclusion from http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-January/002093.html seemed to be that we should wait to add this until we drop Python 2 support so we can use the cleaner Python 3 annotation method without having to redo a bunch of integration work. I believe that means the U cycle.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-04-18 15:56:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

Marking WIP to remove it from the active review list until we're ready to proceed."}, {'account_id': 8122, 'date': '2019-04-18 16:07:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks, I'll update the patch once the py2 gate has been removed. Let's talk about this again in a few months :)"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-10-08 14:24:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Work on this could proceed now since the U cycle is open'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-10-08 15:26:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Workflow

I believe the plan was to move away from the comment-based annotations to a py3-native version? If so, I'm good with dropping the py27 job and doing that now."}, {'account_id': 8122, 'date': '2019-10-08 15:53:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm willing to revisit this patch with a Py3-only syntax as soon as I got time to dive into mypy again :)"}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-10-14 15:19:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

Unfortunately it sounds like we can't quite drop py2 support from Oslo yet. We need all of our consumers to stop gating on it first or we'll break them. There's ongoing discussion of how to do the py2 sunset so hopefully we'll have some more clarity on the timeframe soon."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-12-17 16:59:40.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This can use Python 3-native syntax now. However, it needs some rework to get there. I'm going to abandon this until that happens. Please reopen (or ping me to do so) if you have bandwidth to do this :)"}]

commit_message:
Add a "type" target to tox

It runs the mypy type checker on the whole code base.

Change-Id: I3d1c8733e82bd5d2a0f48646c810e7470bf5f941

subject: Add type annotations for subclasses of Opt
messages:
[{'account_id': 8122, 'date': '2019-01-27 01:34:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8122, 'date': '2019-01-27 01:38:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1 Workflow-1

It is interesting to see that this patch adds an error:

$ tox -etype
...
type runtests: commands[0] | python -m mypy --config-file mypy.ini oslo_config
oslo_config/tests/test_generator.py:96: error: Argument "choices" to "StrOpt" has incompatible type "Tuple[None, str, str, str, str]"; expected "Optional[Sequence[Union[str, Tuple[str, str]]]]"


The line that causes an issue is:
        'choices_opt': cfg.StrOpt('choices_opt',                                    
                                  default='a',                                      
                                  choices=(None, '', 'a', 'b', 'c'),                
                                  help='a string with choices'),  

Two possibilities here:
1) The type hint I added to StrOpt is wrong and should be fixed
2) "None" should not be a valid  value, and this error was caught by mypy'}, {'account_id': 8122, 'date': '2019-01-27 15:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8122, 'date': '2019-01-27 15:03:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1 Workflow-1

See my comment on patchset #1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-01-27 15:55:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> It is interesting to see that this patch adds an error:
 > 
 > $ tox -etype
 > ...
 > type runtests: commands[0] | python -m mypy --config-file mypy.ini
 > oslo_config
 > oslo_config/tests/test_generator.py:96: error: Argument "choices"
 > to "StrOpt" has incompatible type "Tuple[None, str, str, str,
 > str]"; expected "Optional[Sequence[Union[str, Tuple[str, str]]]]"
 > 
 > 
 > The line that causes an issue is:
 > 'choices_opt': cfg.StrOpt('choices_opt',
 > default='a',
 > choices=(None, '', 'a', 'b', 'c'),
 > help='a string with choices'),
 > 
 > Two possibilities here:
 > 1) The type hint I added to StrOpt is wrong and should be fixed
 > 2) "None" should not be a valid  value, and this error was caught
 > by mypy

As odd as it may seem, None is an allowed value for a StrOpt. Every time we talk about changing it, we realize how big of a backwards-incompatible change it would be and stop because of the amount of effort. So, the type hint needs to express that None is allowed.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-12-17 16:59:17.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This can use Python 3-native syntax now. However, it needs some rework to get there. I'm going to abandon this until that happens. Please reopen (or ping me to do so) if you have bandwidth to do this :)"}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-02 08:04:48.000000000', 'message': "WIP Increase rabbitmq tcp backlog

From https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1778428

We need to tune the default rabbitmq tcp listen backlog.  Currently it defaults
to 128, but here's what happens:
Say we have 1500 total rabbitmq client connections spread across a 3 node
cluster, evenly distributed so each node has 500 clients.

Then, we stop rabbitmq on one of the nodes.

Now those 500 client connections all immediately fail over to the other two
node.  Assume roughly even split, and each gets 250 connections simultaneously.
Since the tcp listen backlog is only 128, a large number of the failover
connections cannot connect and get ECONNREFUSED because the kernel just drops
them.

Eventually things retry and the backlog clears, but it just makes things noisy
in the logs and makes failover take a little bit longer.

Upstream docs discuss here:
https://www.rabbitmq.com/networking.html#tuning-for-large-number-of-connections-connection-backlog

Change-Id: If6da4aff016db9a72e1cb9dfc9731f06e062f64d
Suggested-By: John Eckersberg <jeckersb@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Increase rabbitmq tcp backlog

From https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1778428

We need to tune the default rabbitmq tcp listen backlog.  Currently it defaults
to 128, but here's what happens:
Say we have 1500 total rabbitmq client connections spread across a 3 node
cluster, evenly distributed so each node has 500 clients.

Then, we stop rabbitmq on one of the nodes.

Now those 500 client connections all immediately fail over to the other two
node.  Assume roughly even split, and each gets 250 connections simultaneously.
Since the tcp listen backlog is only 128, a large number of the failover
connections cannot connect and get ECONNREFUSED because the kernel just drops
them.

Eventually things retry and the backlog clears, but it just makes things noisy
in the logs and makes failover take a little bit longer.

Upstream docs discuss here:
https://www.rabbitmq.com/networking.html#tuning-for-large-number-of-connections-connection-backlog

Suggested-By: John Eckersberg <jeckersb@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1854704

Change-Id: If6da4aff016db9a72e1cb9dfc9731f06e062f64d

commit_message:
Implements state endpoint for RPC Servers

Adding by default the RPCStateEndpoint to each RPCServer
in order to monitoring their availability.

Change-Id: Iaa016540d315c590a55782cc06f76039860b5842

subject: dynamically update copyright string
messages:
[{'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-08-09 17:22:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-08-09 17:23:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure whether this is preferable to porting more of Ib4f84efab8b3af3ddd47d38d63a91362612bd655"}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-08-09 22:26:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-08-24 15:51:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Easy win'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-09-03 12:24:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-09-25 21:04:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

IANAL, but...

I don't think this is the correct thing to do. Copyright doesn't change to the current year every time you change a document, which is the effect this would have. If I write a document in 2018, my copyright on it remains 2018 even if I subsequently edit it in 2019. I think we want to dynamically generate the date, but it needs to be done at cookiecutter generation time, not at doc build time as I believe this will do. It looks like there's an example of that in https://cookiecutter.readthedocs.io/en/latest/advanced/template_extensions.html that adds a year key to cookiecutter's template variables."}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-09-25 22:57:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

@Ben I googled this, and it appears you have a point.  The copyright year is supposed to refer to the year the work was initially published, e.g. in order to defend against claims of prior art.  However for websites which are regularly updated, it seems to be acceptable practice to specify a range from initial year to most recent update.  Example references:

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2390230/do-copyright-dates-need-to-be-updated
https://www.copyrightlaws.com/copyright-notice-year/
https://www.quora.com/If-you-update-a-site-does-the-copyright-year-change

So in a sense we're both right - we need both the initial year to be generated at cookiecutter generation time, *and* the current year to be updated when the content changes.

Please also note that I did not write this change; I merely ported it from Ib4f84efab8b3af3ddd47d38d63a91362612bd655, so if we fix it here, we'll need to fix in other repos too.

Setting Workflow-1."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-09-26 14:29:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> @Ben I googled this, and it appears you have a point.  The
 > copyright year is supposed to refer to the year the work was
 > initially published, e.g. in order to defend against claims of
 > prior art.  However for websites which are regularly updated, it
 > seems to be acceptable practice to specify a range from initial
 > year to most recent update.  Example references:
 > 
 > https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2390230/do-copyright-dates-need-to-be-updated
 > https://www.copyrightlaws.com/copyright-notice-year/
 > https://www.quora.com/If-you-update-a-site-does-the-copyright-year-change
 > 
 > So in a sense we're both right - we need both the initial year to
 > be generated at cookiecutter generation time, *and* the current
 > year to be updated when the content changes.
 > 
 > Please also note that I did not write this change; I merely ported
 > it from Ib4f84efab8b3af3ddd47d38d63a91362612bd655, so if we fix it
 > here, we'll need to fix in other repos too.
 > 
 > Setting Workflow-1.

Yeah, we should fix it there too. I'm good with a dynamically updated range for the copyright date. ISTR reading that it isn't strictly necessary to do the range, but it's also not wrong and as you say it's a pretty common practice."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-12-17 16:43:36.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I'm going to guess this can be abandoned now."}]

[{'created': '2018-08-09 17:22:29.000000000', 'message': 'dynamically update copyright string

Use the doc build date to produce the copyright string instead of using
a hard-coded value.

Ported-from: Ib4f84efab8b3af3ddd47d38d63a91362612bd655
'}]
commit_message:
dynamically update copyright string

Use the doc build date to produce the copyright string instead of using
a hard-coded value.

Change-Id: I4f2a1ed65e707f5101c91907fa24a5ee79c7b0e9
Ported-from: Ib4f84efab8b3af3ddd47d38d63a91362612bd655

messages:
[{'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-12 21:06:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-13 00:11:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Thanks, see inline comments'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-13 15:02:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-13 15:04:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-13 15:06:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-13 15:07:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-13 18:53:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-13 18:56:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(3 comments)

Thank you @Felipe. Changes committed.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-13 19:01:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-16 16:49:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

The problem here is with patrole-* checkers configuration.

In tempest.conf they have all exes enabled:

http://logs.openstack.org/88/582388/7/check/patrole-admin/b2c299b/controller/logs/tempest_conf.txt.gz
[network-feature-enabled]
api_extensions = all

But in neutron.conf there is no segments plugin enabled.
http://logs.openstack.org/88/582388/7/check/patrole-admin/b2c299b/controller/logs/etc/neutron/neutron_conf.txt.gz

How can we change:
service_plugins = neutron.services.l3_router.l3_router_plugin.L3RouterPlugin,neutron.services.metering.metering_plugin.MeteringPlugin

to:
service_plugins = neutron.services.l3_router.l3_router_plugin.L3RouterPlugin,neutron.services.metering.metering_plugin.MeteringPlugin,segments

Thanks'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-18 19:35:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> The problem here is with patrole-* checkers configuration.
 > 
 > In tempest.conf they have all exes enabled:
 > 
 > http://logs.openstack.org/88/582388/7/check/patrole-admin/b2c299b/controller/logs/tempest_conf.txt.gz
 > [network-feature-enabled]
 > api_extensions = all
 > 
 > But in neutron.conf there is no segments plugin enabled.
 > http://logs.openstack.org/88/582388/7/check/patrole-admin/b2c299b/controller/logs/etc/neutron/neutron_conf.txt.gz
 > 
 > How can we change:
 > service_plugins = neutron.services.l3_router.l3_router_plugin.L3RouterPlugin,neutron.services.metering.metering_plugin.MeteringPlugin
 > 
 > to:
 > service_plugins = neutron.services.l3_router.l3_router_plugin.L3RouterPlugin,neutron.services.metering.metering_plugin.MeteringPlugin,segments
 > 
 > Thanks

I believe this is needed (would need to experiment to know for sure): https://github.com/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin/blob/e80584e81b53ac852c540987d682a4471a51c21d/.zuul.yaml#L28

Which triggers this:  https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/2341a80f466b91351d1b73cb8b62273282a2f7fb/devstack/plugin.sh#L51

Which calls this: https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/2341a80f466b91351d1b73cb8b62273282a2f7fb/devstack/lib/segments#L2

Not sure if more is required.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-19 16:22:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-19 20:48:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Published edit on patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-20 04:03:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-20 04:20:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> (1 comment)

My best guess is that 'enforce_policy': True is needed here: https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/5bddc482e3e7eca97a5769c0c4acd5ec79c1bbe1/neutron_lib/api/definitions/servicetype.py#L35"}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-20 04:27:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Ok, this appears to be a Neutron bug. I made the change I proposed below and both these tests (at least the service_types one) and the Neutron PS I submitted (locally tested) both work: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/584217/'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-20 15:10:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-20 15:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-20 15:31:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-20 15:39:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

I split this patch in 2. This one will contain segment_id part (since this part awaits meeting about moving clients from neutron-tempest-plugin to tempest itself).

And this one for service_type:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/584424/'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-20 18:48:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Published edit on patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-20 20:53:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-21 15:33:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-21 17:43:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-21 20:14:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-21 21:58:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-25 02:29:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

member-pike gate is skipping this because I'm guessing the plugin here isn't available in pike so this means that this is failing across the board for member role. Need to figure out whether this is Neutron bug."}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-27 16:11:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-27 16:12:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-27 18:17:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-27 18:31:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-27 20:24:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Patch Set 21 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-27 20:24:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-07-28 03:07:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-08-01 20:06:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 24:

Now I'm not sure that this problem has something to do with enforce_policy value. 

I populated it all over: 

https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/neutron_lib/api/definitions/segment.py#L38

and:

https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/extensions/segment.py#L85

But my devstack keep failing. Will check for the already known issue with is_admin=True."}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-08-08 03:58:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25: Patch Set 24 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2018-08-30 20:10:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25:

commit_message:
Add tests to cover segment_id attribute in subnets

Test gets and creates subnets with assigned segment [0].
Part of "Increase Neutron RBAC Coverage" initiative [1].

'create_subnet:segment_id'
'get_subnet:segment_id'

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/index.html#segments
[1] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2002641

Story: 2002641
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/584601/
Change-Id: I5606b833a46e3b548e44daf236d2f5b357859abd

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

For more detials information, please refer to:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

* Code-Review-1 by melissaml <ma.lei@99cloud.net>
'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2018-03-12 01:59:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-03-16 00:26:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-03-21 10:07:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

This uses pbr's autodoc feature [1]. You're going to need to migrate away from this to get this working. You can confirm this behavior in the gate by removing the 'build_sphinx' section from the 'setup.cfg' file. Alternatively, you can run this locally.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.reports/blob/1.27.0/setup.cfg#L26-L31"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-04-02 13:17:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-04-09 10:37:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-04-09 13:10:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28614, 'date': '2019-05-03 03:17:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-05-29 15:32:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

recheck

Pretty sure this will need an update to reflect the sphinx req change.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-12-17 16:17:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-12-17 16:30:56.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This no longer does what it says and has been tackled with other paches. Time to abandon.'}]

commit_message:
[Train] Move list_agent and traffic tests to skip list.

It is blocking our train promotion till then putting it in
skip list.

Related-Bug: #1855985

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-17 16:14:07.000000000', 'message': 'ovn: Create the ovn dbs only if the schema file exists

OVN has been split out from openvswitch and it's code is here [1].
With the split we have changed the ovn runtime/data dirs to
/etc/ovn and /usr/share/ovn respectively.

If a user uses latest OVN (when used after the split from
openvswitch), then the extend_start.sh of ovn-nb-db-server and
ovn-sb-db-server will fail because the OVN schema files will be in different
location (new location is /usr/share/ovn/ovn-nb.ovschema and /usr/share/ovn/ovn-sb.ovschema)

The old location is - /usr/share/openvswitch/ovn-nb.ovschema and
/usr/share/openvswitch/ovn-sb.ovschema

This patch checks for the presence of the schema files in the old location before
accessing them.

For latest OVN, it is advisable to use the "ovn-ctl" script to start
and stop OVN ovsdb-servers. ovn-citl script takes care of creating the dbs
and updating the dbs if the schema is updated.

[1] - https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn
      https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/f3e24610ea18eb873dc860f1710432e9aacd27fd

(cherry picked from commit d1a07584ed116c3e046dc0b77370b70374a5c947)
'}]
commit_message:
ovn: Create the ovn dbs only if the schema file exists

OVN has been split out from openvswitch and it's code is here [1].
With the split we have changed the ovn runtime/data dirs to
/etc/ovn and /usr/share/ovn respectively.

If a user uses latest OVN (when used after the split from
openvswitch), then the extend_start.sh of ovn-nb-db-server and
ovn-sb-db-server will fail because the OVN schema files will be in different
location (new location is /usr/share/ovn/ovn-nb.ovschema and /usr/share/ovn/ovn-sb.ovschema)

The old location is - /usr/share/openvswitch/ovn-nb.ovschema and
/usr/share/openvswitch/ovn-sb.ovschema

This patch checks for the presence of the schema files in the old location before
accessing them.

For latest OVN, it is advisable to use the "ovn-ctl" script to start
and stop OVN ovsdb-servers. ovn-citl script takes care of creating the dbs
and updating the dbs if the schema is updated.

[1] - https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn
      https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/f3e24610ea18eb873dc860f1710432e9aacd27fd

Change-Id: If2bab2fac5be28ae7e1cd02de13a2de94fe17bac
Closes-bug: 1849633
Signed-off-by: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit d1a07584ed116c3e046dc0b77370b70374a5c947)

From the commit message I understand that images are still partially broken because no ovn-ctl is used in there?'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2019-10-23 16:26:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> From the commit message I understand that images are still
 > partially broken because no ovn-ctl is used in there?

It will work fine for OVN 2.11.

But when OVN 2.12 is used, the ovn-ctl will be available in /usr/share/ovn/scripts/ovn-ctl
and ovn-nb.ovsschema will be available in - /usr/share/openvswitch/.
And hence this will be broken when OVN 2.12 is used.

With this patch, with OVN 2.12 it will not break. And the user is expected to use ovn-ctl to start ovn db servers - something like how it is done here -  https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn-kubernetes/blob/master/dist/images/ovnkube.sh#L543

Thanks'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2019-10-23 16:27:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

If the user uses ovn-ctl, there is no need to run "ovsdb-tool create..."'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-10-24 07:00:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I don't understand, currently the schema is in /usr/share/openvswitch, with OVN 2.12 it won't be there? This is the only thing this patch changes - checks for existence of the schema.
I think it will always be there, because OVN images are based on openvswitch-base image and install openvswitch package?
Unless you want to change that. Please be more specific.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-10-24 07:04:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

 > Unless you want to change that. Please be more specific.

Hi Michal,  even though /usr/share/openvswitch will exist as well, OVN - as a separate package - is installing the schema files in /usr/share/ovn [0] so this patch is accounting for it.

[0]\xa0https://src.fedoraproject.org/rpms/ovn/blob/f31/f/ovn.spec#_408'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2019-10-24 07:06:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

 > > > And hence this will be broken when OVN 2.12 is used.

 > > >

 > > create..."
 > 
 > I don't understand, currently the schema is in /usr/share/openvswitch,
 > with OVN 2.12 it won't be there? This is the only thing this patch
 > changes - checks for existence of the schema.
 > I think it will always be there, because OVN images are based on
 > openvswitch-base image and install openvswitch package?
 > Unless you want to change that. Please be more specific.

Sorry for the confusion.

The OVN schema files - ovn-nb.ovsschema and ovn-sb.ovschema files are different from the openvswitch schema file.

OVN is completely split into its own separate repository - https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn

The OVN schema files are present here - https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/blob/master/ovn-nb.ovsschema and https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/blob/master/ovn-sb.ovsschema.

When the ovn 2.12 RPM packags are installed, the schema files will be copied to - /usr/share/ovn/scripts - https://src.fedoraproject.org/rpms/ovn/blob/master/f/ovn.spec#_413

The ovn-central rpm copies these schema files.


Please note that, OVN rpms (ovn, ovn-central and ovn-host) are no more sub packages of openvswitch (in centos/fedora).'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-10-24 07:18:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

 > > > > And hence this will be broken when OVN 2.12 is used.

 > > > >

 > > > create..."
 > >
 > > I don't understand, currently the schema is in /usr/share/openvswitch,
 > > with OVN 2.12 it won't be there? This is the only thing this
 > patch
 > > changes - checks for existence of the schema.
 > > I think it will always be there, because OVN images are based on
 > > openvswitch-base image and install openvswitch package?
 > > Unless you want to change that. Please be more specific.
 > 
 > Sorry for the confusion.
 > 
 > The OVN schema files - ovn-nb.ovsschema and ovn-sb.ovschema files
 > are different from the openvswitch schema file.
 > 
 > OVN is completely split into its own separate repository -
 > https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn
 > 
 > The OVN schema files are present here - https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/blob/master/ovn-nb.ovsschema
 > and https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/blob/master/ovn-sb.ovsschema.
 > 
 > When the ovn 2.12 RPM packags are installed, the schema files will
 > be copied to - /usr/share/ovn/scripts - https://src.fedoraproject.org/rpms/ovn/blob/master/f/ovn.spec#_413
 > 
 > The ovn-central rpm copies these schema files.
 > 
 > 
 > Please note that, OVN rpms (ovn, ovn-central and ovn-host) are no
 > more sub packages of openvswitch (in centos/fedora).

Ok - now it's more clear. Please add that simple explanation to the commit message and I think we're good to go (that the schema file will be in different location when using OVN 2.12 and that's why it will fail).'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-10-24 07:19:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

It would be also good to file a bug and attach it here.'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2019-10-24 07:53:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This patch checks for the presence of the schema files in the old location before
accessing them.

For latest OVN, it is advisable to use the "ovn-ctl" script to start
and stop OVN ovsdb-servers. ovn-citl script takes care of creating the dbs
and updating the dbs if the schema is updated.

[1] - https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn
      https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/f3e24610ea18eb873dc860f1710432e9aacd27fd

Change-Id: If2bab2fac5be28ae7e1cd02de13a2de94fe17bac
Closes-bug: 1849633
Signed-off-by: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
ovn: Create the ovn dbs only if the schema file exists

OVN has been split out from openvswitch and it's code is here [1].
With the split we have changed the ovn runtime/data dirs to
/etc/ovn and /usr/share/ovn respectively.

If a user uses latest OVN (when used after the split from
openvswitch), then the extend_start.sh of ovn-nb-db-server and
ovn-sb-db-server will fail because the OVN schema files will be in different
location (new location is /usr/share/ovn/ovn-nb.ovschema and /usr/share/ovn/ovn-sb.ovschema)

The old location is - /usr/share/openvswitch/ovn-nb.ovschema and
/usr/share/openvswitch/ovn-sb.ovschema

This patch checks for the presence of the schema files in the old location before
accessing them.

For latest OVN, it is advisable to use the "ovn-ctl" script to start
and stop OVN ovsdb-servers. ovn-citl script takes care of creating the dbs
and updating the dbs if the schema is updated.

[1] - https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn
      https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/f3e24610ea18eb873dc860f1710432e9aacd27fd

Change-Id: If2bab2fac5be28ae7e1cd02de13a2de94fe17bac
Closes-bug: 1849633
Signed-off-by: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>

commit_message:
WIP: Allow different namespace and version tag of octavia container images

As part of an initiative to support running newer versions of Octavia
images on older deployments, this patch allows the namespace and version
to differ from the rest of the TripleO deployment.

Change-Id: I1b21270ee995008f63268964f14d41671f5dfb61

commit_message:
Add CephGrafana resource to the ControllerStorageNFS role

This change just adds the missing resource to include the missed
CephGrafana bits, fixing the ceph-dashboard deployment scenario.
In this review is also added a validation to make sure that both
ControllerStorage{Dashboard,Nfs} propertly inherit from Controller.

Change-Id: I0075bcb5318462555c7f9f96204ce037016f3e69
Closes-Bug: #1856060
(cherry picked from commit d8dd715d35af7ce43ee21f6813396a107196c224)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-16 07:33:18.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure /var/log/journal exists as soon as possible

It might happen the /var/log/journal directory doesn't exist on a host,
especially if this host is a VM (the image creation usually involves
deep cleaning of the logs).

This absence might lead to log loss with the default journald
configuration, which uses the "auto" Storage.
This "auto" means that:
- if /var/log/journal exists, journald will use it, and it will be
persistent
- if /var/log/journal doesn't exist, journald will use a volatile
location, /run/log/journal, which is dropped upon system reboot

Since logs are important, and "old" logs might be useful after a reboot,
it's better to ensure we have persistent storage for journald.

Closes-Bug: #1856278
Change-Id: I93dcc57aff63b91dab475b0c114b278324434e41
(cherry picked from commit I93dcc57aff63b91dab475b0c114b278324434e41)

This "auto" means that:
- if /var/log/journal exists, journald will use it, and it will be

- if /var/log/journal doesn't exist, journald will use a volatile

Since logs are important, and "old" logs might be useful after a reboot,

Closes-Bug: #1856278

commit_message:
Ensure /var/log/journal exists as soon as possible

It might happen the /var/log/journal directory doesn't exist on a host,
especially if this host is a VM (the image creation usually involves
deep cleaning of the logs).

This absence might lead to log loss with the default journald
configuration, which uses the "auto" Storage.
This "auto" means that:
- if /var/log/journal exists, journald will use it, and it will be
persistent
- if /var/log/journal doesn't exist, journald will use a volatile
location, /run/log/journal, which is dropped upon system reboot

Since logs are important, and "old" logs might be useful after a reboot,
it's better to ensure we have persistent storage for journald.

Closes-Bug: #1856278
Change-Id: I93dcc57aff63b91dab475b0c114b278324434e41
(cherry picked from commit I93dcc57aff63b91dab475b0c114b278324434e41)

commit_message:
Fix client_package for RedHat > 7 and Fedora

/usr/bin/magnum-api-wsgi is available since ussuri,
so using equivalent python script as wsgi source.

Change-Id: I366241b632b5ea3a232cea86ab1e6d8e40780c20
(cherry picked from commit f80ecbd2c8170ffd9b8377026ade2de4403bc04c)

subject: Increase backoffLimit to 10 for helm installer
messages: [{'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-12-17 05:12:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-12-17 10:17:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-12-17 12:16:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-12-17 13:22:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-17 05:12:55.000000000', 'message': 'Increase backoffLimit to 10 for helm installer

The helm installer often quickly reaches the backoffLimit of 5. Increase
this to 10 so that there is a greater chance of successful installation.

Story: 2006765
Task: 37783

commit_message:
Increase backoffLimit to 10 for helm installer

The helm installer often quickly reaches the backoffLimit of 5. Increase
this to 10 so that there is a greater chance of successful installation.

Story: 2006765
Task: 37783

Change-Id: I5293c970bb1696f14c421fdf67abb495b4b8d666
Signed-off-by: Bharat Kunwar <brtknr@bath.edu>
(cherry picked from commit c8752d697610df1419a326624a25826bbc0c6249)

commit_message:
Support for Router Scheduling on addition/removal of chassis

The following patch provides L3HA Rescheduling of gateways when chassis
are added/removed. It reschedules the gateway ports when a new chassis
is added/old one removed. However, the number of chassis where a
gateway can be hosted is limited by the constant MAX_GW_CHASSIS.

Co-Authored-By: Maciej Józefczyk <mjozefcz@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I0d96efe4ceef4168039930738285c19d5c003951
Closes-Bug: #1762691
(cherry picked from commit 12070403db4851ef73011c52124cd335b6807521)

commit_message:
[k8s] Deprecate heapster

Replace heapster for metrics-server as cluster default.
This requires the following labels as default:
tiller_enabled=true
heapster_enabled=false
metrics_server_enabled=true

depends-on: Idc315937a82317b76349bbe8466d900d00194953
depends-on: Icd7f380d87672c00257e34df385d81e1c3e36ddf

Story: 2004816
Task: 28979

Change-Id: I52970244c8977dc5d1a67e7ad7329897b496a0cb
Signed-off-by: Diogo Guerra <dy090.guerra@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2019-12-04 21:45:53.000000000', 'message': 'Remove Python 2.7 support from testing and gates

Makes Python 3 the base python for all tox venvs and removes
py2 jobs from zuul.yaml.

Remaining:
- move the legacy gate jobs from openstack-zuul-jobs to the os-brick
  repo and make them py3 jobs
- adjust setup.cfg to require py3 and remove py2 requirements from
  test-requirements.txt and doc/requirements.txt

Partial-bug: #1853372

Change-Id: Ib447656aa213914bafd50380b3821090f93776f8
'}]
commit_message:
Remove Python 2.7 support from testing and gates

Makes Python 3 the base python for all tox venvs and removes
py2 jobs from zuul.yaml.

Remaining:
- move the legacy gate jobs from openstack-zuul-jobs to the os-brick
  repo and make them py3 jobs
- adjust setup.cfg to require py3 and remove py2 requirements from
  test-requirements.txt and doc/requirements.txt

Partial-bug: #1853372

Change-Id: Ib447656aa213914bafd50380b3821090f93776f8

commit_message:
Ignore devices with OSError

This bug handles OSError when trying to read from CDrom devices with no
disc in the is_pristine_disk function which makes the run-action
list-disks to fail.

Change-Id: I951897a699305604821f2c910ee9ea91582c4e40
Closes-Bug: #1833857
Co-authored-by: Stamatis Katsaounis <skatsaounis@admin.grnet.gr>
Signed-off-by: Alexandros Soumplis <soumplis@admin.grnet.gr>

commit_message:
[neutron] Adjust neighbour table thresholds

When clouds have a large number of hosts, the default size of the ARP
cache is too small. The cache can overflow, which means that the system
has no way to reach some IP addresses.

Increasing threshold limits addresses the situation, in a reasonably
safe way (the maximum impact is 5MB or so of additional RAM used).

More context on this issue:

* http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/arp.7.html
* https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-nova-compute/+bug/1780348
* https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1488938
* https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1690087
* https://github.com/crowbar/crowbar-openstack/commit/0583a0c94996df6b784229e8a534f955eaca85bc
* https://github.com/crowbar/crowbar-openstack/commit/3dd21ea62ac152e40bfdfee4b8e25a528c82a79f
* https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/1651a1805a16212299fe0a91aebb2a91ed39bc6e

Change-Id: I60c871e8eb9f2c086818ff077987f2390930800c
Closes-Bug: #1844349
(cherry picked from commit 4234cc4b5b3ca7172c9d184ed3f145b955f11163)

[neutron] Adjust neighbour table thresholds

When clouds have a large number of hosts, the default size of the ARP

subject: Fix tox environments
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-17 13:18:19.000000000', 'message': "Fix tox environments

Since python-cloudkittyclient is now part of the global requirements,
the upstream requirements file can't be used anymore. This removes the
upper constraints in tox environments and adds cliff to the doc

Change-Id: Id97415eb94ca9a19e3fcd4c0988038b329568e3d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix tox environments

Since python-cloudkittyclient is now part of the global requirements,
the upstream requirements file can't be used anymore. This removes the
upper constraints in tox environments and adds cliff to the doc
dependencies.

Change-Id: Id97415eb94ca9a19e3fcd4c0988038b329568e3d

commit_message:
CiscoNexus: Update and Remove deprecated vars

Update and Remove deprecated variables from Cisco Nexus Config.
* Deprecated variables include vlan_name_prefix, svi_round_robin,
  provider_vlan_name_prefix, persistent_switch_config,
  never_cache_ssh_connection, ssh_port, switch_replay_count,
  nexus_driver, and host_key_checks.
* Change config replay to on by defaulting switch_heartbeat_time=30.
* Replaced method of configurating host_ports_mapping config.

Depends-On: Iee2f869c4054f1120d224994aba8c827f981e6c0
Change-Id: Ibda17afdcf7a6748f15390fd8a0a8b70bb6dfc2b
Closes-bug:  #1793381

commit_message:
CiscoNexus: Update and Remove deprecated vars

Update and Remove deprecated variables from Cisco Nexus Config.
* Deprecated variables include vlan_name_prefix, svi_round_robin,
  provider_vlan_name_prefix, persistent_switch_config,
  never_cache_ssh_connection, ssh_port, switch_replay_count,
  nexus_driver, and host_key_checks.
* Change config replay to on by defaulting switch_heartbeat_time=30.
* Replaced method of configurating host_ports_mapping config.

Change-Id: Iee2f869c4054f1120d224994aba8c827f981e6c0
Closes-bug:  #1793379

subject: [k8s] Update metrics-server
messages: [{'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-12-17 12:17:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-12-17 12:17:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-12-17 12:34:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-17 12:17:03.000000000', 'message': '[k8s] Update metrics-server

Magnum allows to use CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX to specify a local
repository from which we can pull container images. This repository
defaults to the upstream one that is specified in the metrics helm
chart.

* This patch allows for the usage of CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX to
correctly configure the pull of the metric-server container image
from the specified repo.
* Add label metrics_server_chart_tag to allow user to specify
stable/metrics-server chart tag to use
* Add label metrics_server_enabled to allow enable/disable of
component (defaults: true)

Story: 2004816
Task: 37390

Change-Id: Idc315937a82317b76349bbe8466d900d00194953
Signed-off-by: Diogo Guerra <dy090.guerra@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit df52f9c9ea08b67158491583d47a8a10113de129)
'}]
commit_message:
[k8s] Update metrics-server

Magnum allows to use CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX to specify a local
repository from which we can pull container images. This repository
defaults to the upstream one that is specified in the metrics helm
chart.

* This patch allows for the usage of CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX to
correctly configure the pull of the metric-server container image
from the specified repo.
* Add label metrics_server_chart_tag to allow user to specify
stable/metrics-server chart tag to use
* Add label metrics_server_enabled to allow enable/disable of
component (defaults: true)

Story: 2004816
Task: 37390

Change-Id: Idc315937a82317b76349bbe8466d900d00194953
Signed-off-by: Diogo Guerra <dy090.guerra@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit df52f9c9ea08b67158491583d47a8a10113de129)

commit_message:
Correct power state handling for managed in-band inspection

Do not try to configure networks when powered on, unless it's a node
with a SmartNIC, in which case do power on before configuring networks.

A new helper is created based on existing code in agent.py.

Change-Id: I3a8fab7a39b604ed17a690fa9c31b3cd1dbdc6a7
Story: #1528920
Task: #37753
