subject: Make sure glance_api_tls_proxy logs are persisted on the host
messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-12-17 07:15:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/rocky.'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2019-12-17 07:45:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2019-12-17 10:21:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-17 07:15:01.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure glance_api_tls_proxy logs are persisted on the host

The logs for the glance_api_tls_proxy containers are not persisted on
the host and hence get lost at the restart of the container.  Said
container has httpd inside of it so we need to make sure that the httpd
logs are persisted on the host just like the other containers that use
httpd.

Tested this review and I correctly get the logs persisted on a
TLS-everywhere environment:
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/httpd/glance/
total 1040
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root   5864 Nov 28 10:07 error_log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 544043 Nov 28 11:17 glance-api-proxy_access_ssl.log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root   4360 Nov 28 10:07 glance-api-proxy_error_ssl.log

NB: Slight conflict on deployment/glance/glance-api-logging-file-container.yaml

Change-Id: Id4f24e171867adc445eca55b3908360c8f3f6f30
Closes-Bug: #1854343
(cherry picked from commit f22dce44779a3b2d0f08c991d388b2c55829664a)
(cherry picked from commit a764b832e2fc17bd3087d08c129a3b53d2bf083b)
(cherry picked from commit 53465f7f298af33bd0404ed10af09f76b7eab0d8)
(cherry picked from commit cc98ad60ef1181bf0c0582c081022fa4b4592ec2)
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure glance_api_tls_proxy logs are persisted on the host

The logs for the glance_api_tls_proxy containers are not persisted on
the host and hence get lost at the restart of the container.  Said
container has httpd inside of it so we need to make sure that the httpd
logs are persisted on the host just like the other containers that use
httpd.

Tested this review and I correctly get the logs persisted on a
TLS-everywhere environment:
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/httpd/glance/
total 1040
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root   5864 Nov 28 10:07 error_log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 544043 Nov 28 11:17 glance-api-proxy_access_ssl.log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root   4360 Nov 28 10:07 glance-api-proxy_error_ssl.log

NB: Slight conflict on deployment/glance/glance-api-logging-file-container.yaml

Change-Id: Id4f24e171867adc445eca55b3908360c8f3f6f30
Closes-Bug: #1854343
(cherry picked from commit f22dce44779a3b2d0f08c991d388b2c55829664a)
(cherry picked from commit a764b832e2fc17bd3087d08c129a3b53d2bf083b)
(cherry picked from commit 53465f7f298af33bd0404ed10af09f76b7eab0d8)
(cherry picked from commit cc98ad60ef1181bf0c0582c081022fa4b4592ec2)

commit_message:
Fix neutron api TLS logging

This is a partial cherry pick (logging part) of
Ia1c22b8981fb735a052707516f73313c4e5ca93c
Closes-Bug: #1852779

Namely it is the second part of the commit only:
B) The logging in the neutron_server_tls_proxy container is not persisted to the host

Before:
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/httpd/neutron-api/
[root@controller-0 ~]#

After:
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/httpd/neutron-api/
total 136
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root   400 Nov 15 17:43 error_log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 72784 Nov 15 17:53 neutron-api-proxy_access_ssl.log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root  2748 Nov 15 17:43 neutron-api-proxy_error_ssl.log
[root@controller-0 ~]#

We backport only the logging bit because this needs to be fixed all the
way to queens which did not have the ovn-tls work from Kamil.
(I should have split this neutron api TLS fixes in two commits in the
first place, but it's too late for that)

(cherry-picked from 0aecbc772384ae4623fe2013c1698825f268e16b)
Change-Id: Id9b9a15d40467507bdeace56be55b63a6298b560
(cherry picked from commit 0aaae842beee2468fb726aa92faa8b53d7266a9c)

commit_message:
Properly set loopback_users via rabbitmq::loopback_users

Sorta resurrecting https://review.opendev.org/#/c/324016/ now that
https://github.com/voxpupuli/puppet-rabbitmq/pull/699 merged.

This commit prevents a duplicate entry for loopback_users in the
rabbitmq.config file:

{loopback_users, [<<"guest">>]},
{loopback_users, []},

keeping only the expected empty array.

Change-Id: I0c291bf5611f02983c430179206556bae3b38736
(cherry picked from commit 04a5937e1f1482dd3115ddc809c555abea87e69d)

commit_message:
Ensure namespace are recreated upon a k8s client failure

If k8s client is not responsive after the neutron resources for a
namespace are generated a rollback action will be triggered. However
if during that rollback action the k8s is still not accessible, only
the neutron resources will be deleted and the k8s ones will be left
behind, blocking the recreation of the needed neutron resources

Change-Id: I3500b11717f6eeeb5b5686a25f085d26900aa434
Closes-Bug: 1856000

deployments if required.

commit_message:
[k8s] Update metrics-server

Magnum allows to use CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX to specify a local
repository from which we can pull container images. This repository
defaults to the upstream one that is specified in the metrics helm
chart.

* This patch allows for the usage of CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX to
correctly configure the pull of the metric-server container image
from the specified repo.
* Add label metrics_server_chart_tag to allow user to specify
stable/metrics-server chart tag to use
* Add label metrics_server_enabled to allow enable/disable of
component (defaults: true)

Story: 2004816
Task: 37390

Change-Id: Idc315937a82317b76349bbe8466d900d00194953
Signed-off-by: Diogo Guerra <dy090.guerra@gmail.com>

commit_message:
actions/ansible: catch errors when cleaning the work directory

If an error happens during the cleaning of the work directory, we now
catch the error and return the error to Mistral.

Change-Id: Id037525650c9976cd88a8ba2a02b206ec03855aa

messages:
[{'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-09-17 18:23:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-09-17 18:23:36.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to ipv6-only-deployment-and-testing'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-09-20 01:47:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-09-25 07:36:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Looking at results of this new job, it seems for me that functional tests in this project are also testing db migrations: https://openstack.fortnebula.com:13808/v1/AUTH_e8fd161dc34c421a979a9e6421f823e9/zuul_opendev_logs_422/682710/2/check/networking-bgpvpn-functional-ipv6-only/4223aec/logs/testr_results.html.gz so it has nothing to do with used IP version.

IMO better would be to maybe propose IPv6 variant of neutron-tempest-plugin-bgpvpn-bagpipe job which is running some scenario tests and where various IP versions may make a difference.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-12-17 11:44:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

It probably should wait for bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-bagpipe/+bug/1856154 to be fixed and than use job defined in neutron-tempest-plugin repo.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-17 18:23:12.000000000', 'message': "[train][goal] Define new networking-bgpvpn-functional-ipv6-only job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
we need to define the integration job which deploy services
on IPv6 and perform testing to make sure service listen and communicate
over IPv6 properly.

networking-bgpvpn has legacy zuul jobs only so base zuulv3 IPv6 job 'devstack-ipv6' and
'devstack-tempest-ipv6' cannot be used and we have to copy the whole
run.yaml to set the IPv6 setting and run the IPv6 verification
script via post_test_hook.

This commit adds the new job 'networking-bgpvpn-functional-ipv6-only'
run on gate and set the required IPv6 setting'.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35908

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I99e3314c6ba73994863b27525c83b438d91192a2

commit_message:
[train][goal] Define new networking-bgpvpn-functional-ipv6-only job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
we need to define the integration job which deploy services
on IPv6 and perform testing to make sure service listen and communicate
over IPv6 properly.

networking-bgpvpn has legacy zuul jobs only so base zuulv3 IPv6 job 'devstack-ipv6' and
'devstack-tempest-ipv6' cannot be used and we have to copy the whole
run.yaml to set the IPv6 setting and run the IPv6 verification
script via post_test_hook.

This commit adds the new job 'networking-bgpvpn-functional-ipv6-only'
run on gate and set the required IPv6 setting'.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35908

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I99e3314c6ba73994863b27525c83b438d91192a2

commit_message:
Replace ostempest job in favor of plain standalone

tripleo-ci-centos-7-standalone-os-tempest was added while porting
tripleo ci jobs to os_tempest and now the porting is done.

tripleo-ci-centos-7-standalone-os-tempest and
tripleo-ci-centos-7-standalone are the same job, It replaces the
existing os_tempest job to plain tripleo standalone job to keep
consistency at all places.

tripleo-ci-centos-7-standalone-os-tempest definition should be kept
as itis since it is used for stable branches in some projects.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/697973
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/697974
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/697975
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/697989

Change-Id: I8044aa3f96527d2e7039841ef368ff6a8fff7564

commit_message:
Ensure leftover LBaaS are deleted upon Controller start

When the deletion of a SVC is triggered while the load balancer
is still creating and the controller restarts, the deletion
event will be gone and the lbaas remains. This commit fixes
the issue, by removing the leftover lbaas upon controller restart.

Change-Id: I2d7dd14c3f05b0b1da6db7ac9b58731e34b593e6

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-16 18:03:06.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ib07a6a5287b27a15efe7ef9b218c50fabedda674
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ib07a6a5287b27a15efe7ef9b218c50fabedda674

Sem-Ver: feature
'}]
commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: Ifeef4c911d53a7ce216548bf5baea1719a068e80
Sem-Ver: feature

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-21 12:09:28.000000000', 'message': 'Swift Global Cluster

This patchset adds a support for Swift Global Cluster feature as described at:

https://docs.openstack.org/swift/latest/overview_global_cluster.html

It allows specifying affinity settings as parrt of the deployment. Moreover,
the master - slave relation is introduced for the purpose of rings distribution
across proxy nodes participating in the Swift Global Cluster.

Change-Id: I406445493e2226aa5ae40a09c9053ac8633a46e9
Closes-Bug: 1815879
Depends-On: I11b6c7802e5bfbd61b06e4d11c65804a165781b6

commit_message:
Swift Global Cluster

This patchset adds a support for Swift Global Cluster feature as
described at:

https://docs.openstack.org/swift/latest/overview_global_cluster.html

It allows specifying affinity settings as parrt of the deployment.
Moreover, the master - slave relation is introduced for the purpose of
rings distribution across proxy nodes participating in the Swift Global
Cluster.

Change-Id: I406445493e2226aa5ae40a09c9053ac8633a46e9
Closes-Bug: 1815879
Depends-On: I11b6c7802e5bfbd61b06e4d11c65804a165781b6

commit_message:
Fix Train release notes

These are mostly formatting fixes, but also a correction of the default
value of pip_upper_constraints_file.

Change-Id: Iadb1b45644865d67e170f94d301d3eeeab2654ee

commit_message:
Swift Global Cluster

This patchset adds a support for Swift Global Cluster feature as
described at:

https://docs.openstack.org/swift/latest/overview_global_cluster.html

It allows specifying 'region' config option as part of the deployment.
Theregion is reflected later on in the Swift rings.

Change-Id: I11b6c7802e5bfbd61b06e4d11c65804a165781b6
Partial-Bug: 1815879
Needed-By: I406445493e2226aa5ae40a09c9053ac8633a46e9

commit_message:
Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

python-ironic-inspector-client is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

Change-Id: I8cc4589378e8e7cac860080be1099cbb79b4a6e5

Change-Id: I67521122e8a87b2e0637e8f671c3fbc0b8f0fbb5
'}]
commit_message:
Synchronise with kayobe-config for Train

Synchronises the configuration with kayobe-config prior to creating a
stable/train branch.

This commit also defines the Ceph and Swift storage networks, which had
been skipped in the Stein sync.

Change-Id: I67521122e8a87b2e0637e8f671c3fbc0b8f0fbb5

commit_message:
Add "idp-discovery-service-url" option

Allow the usage of an IDP discovery service for multiple IDPs.
Make use of "MellonDiscoveryURL" option in "mod_auth_mellon"
Apache module.

Change-Id: I2eed6dc3c57a51ed12f8ca4b31b46a13bc8fa911
Signed-off-by: Yanos Angelopoulos <yanos@admin.grnet.gr>

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/667071/2 : SUCCESS in 1h 33m 40s'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2019-06-25 14:09:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 19956, 'date': '2019-06-26 01:47:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (3 comments)

Although keepalived started by state-change-monitor, if the original role is master, it still has the brain split problem.
In https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1602320, it metioned l3 agent send SIGHUP signal TWICE, cause VRRP process terninated. And in my scenario, I restart the l3-agent too many time in a short time, this also will cause SIGHUP signal sent too many times, and at last this caused keepalived dead for a while, many router on this node are brain split. So I think if we cleanup the backup's vip in the l3-agent start, it will not break the business.  Use  --admin-state-up False/True also worked, but it will break the current business."}, {'account_id': 19956, 'date': '2019-06-26 02:11:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> (3 comments)
And too many l3-agent restart caused state-change-monitor failed to start(the monitor pid file was locked), then the keepalived cannot be started by the monitor.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-07-01 13:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 19956, 'date': '2019-07-02 02:15:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 19956, 'date': '2019-07-02 02:21:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> (3 comments)

Sorry, maybe what I described is not clear, I mean I restart neutron-l3-agent too many times in a short time that trigger kill -HUP <pid> too many times, this will cause the process terminated.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-07-02 03:51:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/667071/3 : SUCCESS in 1h 35m 44s'}, {'account_id': 19956, 'date': '2019-07-08 09:14:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-07-08 10:55:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Cleanup ipv4 address when keepalived is dead

If a router's keepalived is dead(kill -9 <pid>, or
kill -HUP <pid> too many times), and the original
role in this node is master, this will cause brain
split. Then when we restart neutron-l3-agent,
the ipv6 addresses will be cleaned, but the ipv4
addresses still exist, we should also cleanup ipv4
addresses before enable keepalived.

Closes-Bug: #1833653
Change-Id: Id612a65d905c9efe78b4d57af6d88cac4318854d

commit_message:
Delegate and run once debug start-at-task messages

Instead of executing these debug tasks for every host, we can delegate
them to localhost and only run them once.

Change-Id: I367db4c9e743c77f121751ecca6bb4996b8a3df9
(cherry picked from commit a85d3d7069b2df9e991fc1061d34d92c1998469a)

commit_message:
Explicitly disable DVR for OVN HA deployment

DVR is set as default by [1]. For non-DVR deployments
we need to explicitly disable it.
To have flat naming convention we decided to rename
neutron-ovn-ha.yaml template to neutron-ovn-non-dvr-ha.yaml.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/593056/
Co-Authored-By: Eran Kuris <ekuris@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ia362e63927523a10433d247b86cb1a1c35233582

[{'created': '2019-12-13 13:01:52.000000000', 'message': "Retry the connection to heat-api when 500 code

In a rare case like httpd reload by logrotate, heat-api returns
500 code. If this happens, trpleoclient can't get the status of
the stack even though the process is still on-going.

To handle this situation, tipleoclient should retry when it can't
get the stack information by 500 code.

Change-Id: I97a6825f4ff9f125eb597e5b7bd0c553c37e49e7
Closes-Bug: #1855633
(cherry picked from commit 932fc6755a8315ccde2e90848ad3224f1fe16735)
"}]
commit_message:
Retry the connection to heat-api when 500 code

In a rare case like httpd reload by logrotate, heat-api returns
500 code. If this happens, trpleoclient can't get the status of
the stack even though the process is still on-going.

To handle this situation, tipleoclient should retry when it can't
get the stack information by 500 code.

Change-Id: I97a6825f4ff9f125eb597e5b7bd0c553c37e49e7
Closes-Bug: #1855633
(cherry picked from commit 932fc6755a8315ccde2e90848ad3224f1fe16735)

commit_message:
Quote output values for overcloudrc

If the overcloudrc values have spaces, we need to quote them to ensure
it gets parsed correctly.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/699010/
Change-Id: I06995dee0ec7eabda16793aa42cae7197c4959f5
Closes-Bug: #1854868
(cherry picked from commit 5d44457ae16ebb3298143e04dbf0c0c5e5249553)

'}, {'created': '2019-11-13 16:23:53.000000000', 'message': 'TripleO Validator CLI Refactor

This patch hardly refactors the TripleO Validator CLI. The 'List'
subcommand has been split in different new subcommands which does "one
thing and only one thing". It also adds the support for the TripleO
history file and integrates better the CLI with the openstack client
library, which simplifies it a lot.

The subcommands are:

- To display the full list of validations or by group(s):
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator list
  ```

- To display full details about one validation:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator show
  ```

- To display the available parameters for one or multiple validations,
  export them in a JSON or YAML file:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator show parameter
  ```

- To display full details about the groups used by the validations:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator group info
  ```

- To run one or several validations by names or by groups:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator run
  ```

Depends-On: I56b9d39c113cfb30695fe8cf2740ae147b0dd3e4
Change-Id: I09e2cba484d3a91915fb9294bc351b5d7f3aca0f
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-11-14 10:38:12.000000000', 'message': 'TripleO Validator CLI Refactor

commit_message:
TripleO Validator CLI Refactor

This patch hardly refactors the TripleO Validator CLI. The 'List'
subcommand has been split in different new subcommands which does "one
thing and only one thing". It also adds the support for the TripleO
history file and integrates better the CLI with the openstack client
library, which simplifies it a lot.

The subcommands are:

- To display the full list of validations or by group(s):
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator list
  ```

- To display full details about one validation:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator show
  ```

- To display the available parameters for one or multiple validations,
  export them in a JSON or YAML file:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator show parameter
  ```

- To display full details about the groups used by the validations:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator group info
  ```

- To run one or several validations by names or by groups:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator run
  ```

Depends-On: I56b9d39c113cfb30695fe8cf2740ae147b0dd3e4
Change-Id: I09e2cba484d3a91915fb9294bc351b5d7f3aca0f
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use olso to parse size strings

This uses oslo.utils size parser instead of implementing our own.  The
only intentional difference here is that a number with no units is an
error (it seems more likely that you've forgotten the units than you
really want to specify things in bytes).

Change-Id: Iecb1ad5bee1619202a41e9d9707db3bc744dd239
Depends-On: I772bcb6651484d68afabd1965e5db033439c6257

commit_message:
Don't use hasattr to lazy-load properties

This is a better pattern overall and most classes
has already had this changed as part of the service
refactor.

Change-Id: Ia6fb1f78a449bee48b9e4c86ca1334d0b28b28ef

commit_message:
Add dib_selinux_enabled var to disable selinux rhel8 image builds

For related-bug we need to disable selinux for rhel8 image build
This adds a new dib_selinux_enabled var to oooci-build-images role
defaulting to false. Testing at [1]

Related-Bug: 1853028
[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/23919/
Change-Id: I9004b0cba1dbd8d92db24369ed04351164e85766

yeah, tests are doing right checks as per created resources and list resource. with default RBAC any non-admin user should not be able to get the other tenant ports.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-08-19 08:51:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 28719, 'date': '2019-08-19 14:30:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thank you for the feedback. I don't know if it is disallowed to use pre-previsioned credentials that have the admin role, but it's not clear what value the check of "only one tenant is returned" adds to this specific test.

Even for non-admin credentials, the asserts may need to be adjusted - the proposed patchset was an effort to more accurately test this one API call.'}, {'account_id': 17887, 'date': '2019-08-19 23:37:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

1) "I don't know if it is disallowed to use pre-previsioned credentials that have the admin role"
—— Yes, in that case many negative testcases will fail, because we expect non-admin user not being allowed to do something.

2) It's strange for an environment to return ports from different tenants and with same fixed_ip:)

3) "but it's not clear what value the check of "only one tenant is returned" adds to this specific test."
—— I don't know the original aim, but if without obvious reason, generally we are careful to remove some checkes.

commit_message:
Update test_port_list_filter_by_ip pass conditions

This patchset updates the pass assertions to check that the created
port is in the list of ports returned, and that every port returned
has a matching fixed IP.

The check that all the ports in the response are from a single tenant
is retained, so this test is expected to sometimes fail if run with
admin credentials.

Change-Id: Ia20af71d031504aa08fc0ea92fd35cbc408edba3
Partial-Bug: #1840401

[{'created': '2019-12-04 17:52:35.000000000', 'message': "Fix neutron api TLS logging

This is a partial cherry pick (logging part) of
Ia1c22b8981fb735a052707516f73313c4e5ca93c
Closes-Bug: #1852779

Namely it is the second part of the commit only:
B) The logging in the neutron_server_tls_proxy container is not persisted to the host

Before:
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/httpd/neutron-api/
[root@controller-0 ~]#

After:
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/httpd/neutron-api/
total 136
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root   400 Nov 15 17:43 error_log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 72784 Nov 15 17:53 neutron-api-proxy_access_ssl.log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root  2748 Nov 15 17:43 neutron-api-proxy_error_ssl.log
[root@controller-0 ~]#

We backport only the logging bit because this needs to be fixed all the
way to queens which did not have the ovn-tls work from Kamil.
(I should have split this neutron api TLS fixes in two commits in the
first place, but it's too late for that)

(cherry-picked from 0aecbc772384ae4623fe2013c1698825f268e16b)
Change-Id: Id9b9a15d40467507bdeace56be55b63a6298b560
"}]
commit_message:
Fix neutron api TLS logging

This is a partial cherry pick (logging part) of
Ia1c22b8981fb735a052707516f73313c4e5ca93c
Closes-Bug: #1852779

Namely it is the second part of the commit only:
B) The logging in the neutron_server_tls_proxy container is not persisted to the host

Before:
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/httpd/neutron-api/
[root@controller-0 ~]#

After:
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/httpd/neutron-api/
total 136
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root   400 Nov 15 17:43 error_log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 72784 Nov 15 17:53 neutron-api-proxy_access_ssl.log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root  2748 Nov 15 17:43 neutron-api-proxy_error_ssl.log
[root@controller-0 ~]#

We backport only the logging bit because this needs to be fixed all the
way to queens which did not have the ovn-tls work from Kamil.
(I should have split this neutron api TLS fixes in two commits in the
first place, but it's too late for that)

(cherry-picked from 0aecbc772384ae4623fe2013c1698825f268e16b)
Change-Id: Id9b9a15d40467507bdeace56be55b63a6298b560

[{'created': '2019-12-02 15:54:00.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure glance_api_tls_proxy logs are persisted on the host

The logs for the glance_api_tls_proxy containers are not persisted on
the host and hence get lost at the restart of the container.  Said
container has httpd inside of it so we need to make sure that the httpd
logs are persisted on the host just like the other containers that use
httpd.

Tested this review and I correctly get the logs persisted on a
TLS-everywhere environment:
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/httpd/glance/
total 1040
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root   5864 Nov 28 10:07 error_log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 544043 Nov 28 11:17 glance-api-proxy_access_ssl.log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root   4360 Nov 28 10:07 glance-api-proxy_error_ssl.log

NB: Slight conflict on deployment/glance/glance-api-logging-file-container.yaml

Change-Id: Id4f24e171867adc445eca55b3908360c8f3f6f30
Closes-Bug: #1854343
(cherry picked from commit f22dce44779a3b2d0f08c991d388b2c55829664a)
(cherry picked from commit a764b832e2fc17bd3087d08c129a3b53d2bf083b)
(cherry picked from commit 53465f7f298af33bd0404ed10af09f76b7eab0d8)
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure glance_api_tls_proxy logs are persisted on the host

The logs for the glance_api_tls_proxy containers are not persisted on
the host and hence get lost at the restart of the container.  Said
container has httpd inside of it so we need to make sure that the httpd
logs are persisted on the host just like the other containers that use
httpd.

Tested this review and I correctly get the logs persisted on a
TLS-everywhere environment:
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/httpd/glance/
total 1040
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root   5864 Nov 28 10:07 error_log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 544043 Nov 28 11:17 glance-api-proxy_access_ssl.log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root   4360 Nov 28 10:07 glance-api-proxy_error_ssl.log

NB: Slight conflict on deployment/glance/glance-api-logging-file-container.yaml

Change-Id: Id4f24e171867adc445eca55b3908360c8f3f6f30
Closes-Bug: #1854343
(cherry picked from commit f22dce44779a3b2d0f08c991d388b2c55829664a)
(cherry picked from commit a764b832e2fc17bd3087d08c129a3b53d2bf083b)
(cherry picked from commit 53465f7f298af33bd0404ed10af09f76b7eab0d8)

commit_message:
Install suitable service_providers

If we wants VPN works on CentOS, we can set IPSEC_PACKAGE
to libreswan, but vpn service_providers still related
to strongswan.

This patch set the value of NEUTRON_VPNAAS_SERVICE_PROVIDER
according to IPSEC_PACKAGE in devstack/settings.

Change-Id: I893a191a8a1aa5a5beb8a73a9df4d1df2fb0c2f8

commit_message:
[Rocky and older] Actually install tmpwatch on overcloud nodes

This is the equivalent of https://review.opendev.org/698232 but we can't
backport it "as-is" due to the huge tree change.

Closes-Bug: #1855802

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-03 20:44:49.000000000', 'message': "Install rng-tools in Red Hat family distro images

Make sure rngd, a hardware RNG entropy gatherer daemon, is installed on
all DIB-built Red Hat family distro images. rngd comes installed by
default in a typical base installation as it's proven to help speed
things up.

Nova attaches the virtio-rng-pci device to VMs. virtio-rng-pci is a
device that provides feed random data. However, it is of little to no
use if the virtual machine is not configured to make use of given
device. That is where rngd can help by facilitating entropy to the pool
from virtio-rng-pci.

$ openstack image set --property hw_rng_model=virtio [...]
$ openstack flavor set --property hw_rng:allowed=True [...]

DIB-built minimal images do not come with rngd installed. This patch
makes sure the daemon is installed. Its systemd service comes already
enabled.

Change-Id: I34a989dbfc57d4c98113ac25c81dfb500945ff0a
"}, {'created': '2019-12-12 20:26:06.000000000', 'message': "Install rng-tools in Red Hat family distro images

Make sure rngd, a hardware RNG entropy gatherer daemon, is installed on
all DIB-built Red Hat family distro images. rngd comes installed by
default in a typical base installation as it's proven to help speed
things up.

Nova attaches the virtio-rng-pci device to VMs. virtio-rng-pci is a
device that provides feed random data. However, it is of little to no
use if the virtual machine is not configured to make use of given
device. That is where rngd can help by facilitating entropy to the pool
from virtio-rng-pci.

$ openstack image set --property hw_rng_model=virtio [...]
$ openstack flavor set --property hw_rng:allowed=True [...]

DIB-built minimal images do not come with rngd installed. This patch
makes sure the daemon is installed. Its systemd service comes already
enabled.

Change-Id: I34a989dbfc57d4c98113ac25c81dfb500945ff0a
"}]
commit_message:
Install rng-tools in Red Hat family distro images

Make sure rngd, a hardware RNG entropy gatherer daemon, is installed on
all DIB-built Red Hat family distro images. rngd comes installed by
default in a typical base installation as it's proven to help speed
things up.

Nova attaches the virtio-rng-pci device to VMs. virtio-rng-pci is a
device that provides feed random data. However, it is of little to no
use if the virtual machine is not configured to make use of given
device. That is where rngd can help by facilitating entropy to the pool
from virtio-rng-pci.

$ openstack image set --property hw_rng_model=virtio [...]
$ openstack flavor set --property hw_rng:allowed=True [...]

DIB-built minimal images do not come with rngd installed. This patch
makes sure the daemon is installed. Its systemd service comes already
enabled.

Change-Id: I34a989dbfc57d4c98113ac25c81dfb500945ff0a

parameter as dictionary instead of list.

commit_message:
OvS DPDK parameters failing in NIC Partitioning

This change is to fix the finding DPDK device name issue in
OvS DPDK derive parameters logic. Currently mistral fails to
derive OvS DPDK parameters in NIC Partitioning and getting
error 'Unable to determine NUMA node for DPDK NIC:'

Change-Id: I8dfc2494d35d5fce52d573f9edcafbe11ab7faac
Closes-Bug: #1855159
(cherry picked from commit 9641cc2ccb9d6bc5757f2bb888b374dedc2d2733)

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ie141d061ec000aabb1c96134ed64f0a90284f8a4

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ia5912b4f6b1e2a0b9205087e3b489230c1292bdb

subject: doc: Avoid duplicated entries in toctree
messages:
[{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-07-24 08:19:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-07-26 06:42:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I don't mind this layout, but for mine, I think just remove the direct links above.  it's much better to have an explanation that just a link where you just have the title."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-10-02 08:47:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-10-02 08:48:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Sorry for late follow-up. Train cycle is almost over, so I can find time to move this forward.

> I don't mind this layout, but for mine, I think just remove the direct links above.  it's much better to have an explanation that just a link where you just have the title.

The confusing point to me is when I visit "Guides" section in the TOC of the top page [1] I see two same titles (like "All-In-One Single VM") but two links with a same title lead me to different places. The upper one jumps to a dedicated page and the below one jumps to a corresponding section in guides.html.

In addition, the current version looks tricky in the generated PDF doc [2].
You can see duplicated sections under "Guides" section.

 2.5 Guides
 2.5.1 All-In-One Single VM
 ..
 2.5.10 All-In-One Single VM

My change addresses both problems.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/devstack/latest/#contents
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/devstack/latest/doc-devstack.pdf'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-10-02 08:55:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

This needs more work. It works for PDF but does not work for HTML.... :-('}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-12-17 05:37:39.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

I have no good idea to improve the TOC both in HTML and PDF.'}]

commit_message:
doc: Avoid duplicated entries in toctree

TOC shows duplicated entries from guides.rst now.
Titles in guides.rst and toctree entries in guides.rst
are duplicated. This commit converts titles in guides.rst
to a list to avoid it.

This change also improves the structure of the "Guides" section
in the PDF docs by not using titles in guides.rst and moving
the (hidden) toctree to the bottom of guides.rst.

Change-Id: I2985743116760fc4503d3f63ae83324be356c8d6

Blacklist bandit 1.6.0 due to directory exclusion bug

Bandit 1.6.0 introduces a regression[0] with the -x option,
a fix is expected to be included in 1.6.1 soon.

[0] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488
[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

Change-Id: Ifc8cd18de834952b9ed9fca6d5df15dd08383642

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-28 07:17:13.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] LVM testing for xenial-build-succeeds

These two config files were extracted from the original change
I697bfbf042816c5ddf170bde9534cc4f0c7279ff to do more advanced block
device configuration during the ubuntu-minimal build test.

I (ianw) do not think it is wise to switch the gate defaults to this
without any prior history of runs.  We should incorporate these
advanced jobs ontop of the native zuulv3 jobs in
Ied67a31f0d31503d13eccad8662c29740c93f33e as separate tests.  This is
created so we can easily find the configs.

Change-Id: I65fb573a12eb62dcb1fef4ff81bf14db538f4ce1
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] LVM testing for xenial-build-succeeds

These two config files were extracted from the original change
I697bfbf042816c5ddf170bde9534cc4f0c7279ff to do more advanced block
device configuration during the ubuntu-minimal build test.

I (ianw) do not think it is wise to switch the gate defaults to this
without any prior history of runs.  We should incorporate these
advanced jobs ontop of the native zuulv3 jobs in
Ied67a31f0d31503d13eccad8662c29740c93f33e as separate tests.  This is
created so we can easily find the configs.

Change-Id: I65fb573a12eb62dcb1fef4ff81bf14db538f4ce1
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

commit_message:
Strip trailing null in env var output

This leads to

 warning: command substitution: ignored null byte in input

with recent bash versions.  Doesn't affect anything, but easy enough
to drop the trailing null and silence the warning.

Change-Id: I620c56a8f47d94dd1242e1c8fb1bd77d76a1e23d

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-22 02:24:46.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Global element defaults

Currently there is no place to keep global variables to be exported to
all elements.  "lib/common-defaults" seems like it might be it, but
this is not sourced by instack -- it's really "common" to
disk-image-create & ramdisk-image-create

Create a separate file that can be sourced by
[disk|ramdisk]-image-create and instack to provide global variables to
elements.

To facilitate this, we add a "-d" command that outputs the location of
this file.  Wrappers (instack) should ensure this is sourced before
running any element scripts.

Change-Id: Ic37d04420236e45d0c7dc74c4bcfbe5a41d911cd
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Global element defaults

Currently there is no place to keep global variables to be exported to
all elements.  "lib/common-defaults" seems like it might be it, but
this is not sourced by instack -- it's really "common" to
disk-image-create & ramdisk-image-create

Create a separate file that can be sourced by
[disk|ramdisk]-image-create and instack to provide global variables to
elements.

To facilitate this, we add a "-d" command that outputs the location of
this file.  Wrappers (instack) should ensure this is sourced before
running any element scripts.

Change-Id: Ic37d04420236e45d0c7dc74c4bcfbe5a41d911cd

(2 comments)

A couple of minor notes.

Considering I see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/208321/, wouldn't it make more sense to just consolidate the two - incompatible - variables into a single one? For example:

 export DIB_PACKAGE_CACHE_MODE=shared

packages are cached in a shared (out of the image) cache -- i.e. the current behaviour when nothing is specified

 export DIB_PACKAGE_CACHE_MODE=no

packages are not cached at all

 export DIB_PACKAGE_CACHE_MODE=in-image

(or any other better name) packages are kept in the package manager cache within the image, no shared cache is used"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-10-12 20:15:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Verified-1

[{'created': '2015-08-11 06:11:11.000000000', 'message': 'Add DIB_USE_PACKAGE_CACHE variable

Currently yum keeps a local package cache and symlinks it into the
build by default, and it can not be turned off.

On the other hand, deb builds have a similar mechanism with
DIB_APT_LOCAL_CACHE; which is on by default but actually undocumented
as a flag.

Consolidate these into a single DIB_USE_PACKAGE_CACHE flag that is by
default on (maintaining the status-quo) but able to be turned-off.

Document this in README.rst (we can refactor this into docs later)

Change-Id: I084d950785f8c557ee795b69e38f13ab1a427322

commit_message:
Add DIB_USE_PACKAGE_CACHE variable

Currently yum keeps a local package cache and symlinks it into the
build by default, and it can not be turned off.

On the other hand, deb builds have a similar mechanism with
DIB_APT_LOCAL_CACHE.

Consolidate these into a single DIB_USE_PACKAGE_CACHE flag that is by
default on (maintaining the status-quo) but able to be turned-off.
Add a deprecation note for DIB_APT_LOCAL_CACHE.  Document this in the
developer documentation on caches, and add references to the elements
documentation.

Change-Id: I084d950785f8c557ee795b69e38f13ab1a427322

subject: Add DIB_KEEP_PACKAGE_CACHE variable

(1 comment)

No -1, but I was thinking we could go a different route.  Why don't we just cache everything out of the box, like we do with APT. Then, we can add a new flag to toggle cleaning of the cache.

This way, the functionality should be the same between APT and YUM.

As for the cache directory, I also think we should create a bindmount like we do for dpkg, again, allowing the user to toggle DIB_APT_LOCAL_CACHE or not."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2015-08-07 03:59:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

[{'created': '2015-08-03 05:59:55.000000000', 'message': 'Implement package caching for yum/dnf element

Implement a flag DIB_KEEP_PACKAGE_CACHE which keeps downloaded
packages.

Note this is incompatible with the current situation of using a yum
cache bind-mounted into the chroot.  We could copy that cache back
into the image at the end, but it might contain all sorts of things
from other runs that are not relevant to the image currently building.
Documentation has been enhanced to discuss this.

The difference in build-size is about:

480M fedora.qcow2
708M fedora-with-cache.qcow2

Change-Id: I55bac1c80bbfd4e94f0446dd15e6673a9573e90a

Implement a flag DIB_KEEP_PACKAGE_CACHE which keeps downloaded
packages.

Note this is incompatible with the DIB_USE_PACKAGE_CACHE flag that
uses the external package-cache bind-mounted into the chroot.  We
*could* copy that cache back into the image at the end, but it might
contain all sorts of things from other runs that are not relevant to
the image currently building.  Documentation has been enhanced to
discuss this, and the script should fail with a useful message if you
try to enable both.

The DIB_DISABLE_APT_CLEANUP flag is removed for this generic flag.

The difference in build-size for fedora is about:

480M fedora.qcow2
708M fedora-with-cache.qcow2

362M ubuntu.qcow2
450M ubuntu-with-cache.qcow2

Change-Id: I55bac1c80bbfd4e94f0446dd15e6673a9573e90a

commit_message:
Add DIB_KEEP_PACKAGE_CACHE variable

Implement a flag DIB_KEEP_PACKAGE_CACHE which keeps downloaded
packages.

Note this is incompatible with the DIB_USE_PACKAGE_CACHE flag that
uses the external package-cache bind-mounted into the chroot.  We
*could* copy that cache back into the image at the end, but it might
contain all sorts of things from other runs that are not relevant to
the image currently building.  Documentation has been enhanced to
discuss this, and the script should fail with a useful message if you
try to enable both.

The DIB_DISABLE_APT_CLEANUP flag is deprecated for this generic flag.

The difference in build-size for fedora is about:

480M fedora.qcow2
708M fedora-with-cache.qcow2

362M ubuntu.qcow2
450M ubuntu-with-cache.qcow2

Change-Id: I55bac1c80bbfd4e94f0446dd15e6673a9573e90a

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-29 03:15:39.000000000', 'message': '[DNM] Separate initial state and create state

This is a bunch of work I did to separate out the initial state
from the state created during create()

We have a chicken and egg problem with the get-value calls; some of
them want values that are known after we've parsed all the
configuration (e.g. rootfs mount & file system type) ... logically we
could grab them from the state.  However, since state generation is
wrapped up with the actual create() calls, it's too late.

In theory, we could separate out initial state generation, from the
config file(s), and then do the create as a totally separate call

This has a few unresolved issues.  For example, we call "init" before
finding the size of the disk with "du", then we put the new size value
in and call "create"; which re-reads this.

So quite a lot of refactoring has to be done to get this idea to work.
I'm just putting this here as a record of how to get started if we
need this...

Change-Id: Ic86177015c5c22f32e2d0c598eed28ad891dc218
'}]
commit_message:
[DNM] Separate initial state and create state

This is a bunch of work I did to separate out the initial state
from the state created during create()

We have a chicken and egg problem with the get-value calls; some of
them want values that are known after we've parsed all the
configuration (e.g. rootfs mount & file system type) ... logically we
could grab them from the state.  However, since state generation is
wrapped up with the actual create() calls, it's too late.

In theory, we could separate out initial state generation, from the
config file(s), and then do the create as a totally separate call

This has a few unresolved issues.  For example, we call "init" before
finding the size of the disk with "du", then we put the new size value
in and call "create"; which re-reads this.

So quite a lot of refactoring has to be done to get this idea to work.
I'm just putting this here as a record of how to get started if we
need this...

Change-Id: Ic86177015c5c22f32e2d0c598eed28ad891dc218

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-15 02:52:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add a parent log to iterate timeout util

With debug logs you get quite a lot of

 2018-06-15 02:06:38,671 DEBUG: openstack.iterate_timeout Waiting 2.0 seconds

as things progress.  Logically these messages are really related to
whatever called them, more than "openstack.iterate_timeout".  For
logging hierarchy purposes you'd prefer for it to be captured with its
parent, as it is indicating a loop happening there.

Add a parent argument to setup_logging that will indicate to register
the new logger as a child of this.

Use this argument in the util.iterate_timeout call

Plumb in some existing loggers as parents for most of the
iterate_timeout calls.

Change-Id: Ibc3afe21e8987b54f1de68bde5c9f1a30201304f
'}, {'created': '2018-06-15 07:18:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add a parent log to iterate timeout util

With debug logs you get quite a lot of

 2018-06-15 02:06:38,671 DEBUG: openstack.iterate_timeout Waiting 2.0 seconds

as things progress.  Logically these messages are really related to
whatever called them, more than "openstack.iterate_timeout".  For
logging hierarchy purposes you'd prefer for it to be captured with its
parent, as it is indicating a loop happening there.

Add a parent argument to setup_logging that will indicate to register
the new logger as a child of this.

Use this argument in the util.iterate_timeout call

Plumb in some existing loggers as parents for most of the
iterate_timeout calls.

Change-Id: Ibc3afe21e8987b54f1de68bde5c9f1a30201304f
'}]
commit_message:
Add a parent log to iterate timeout util

With debug logs you get quite a lot of

 2018-06-15 02:06:38,671 DEBUG: openstack.iterate_timeout Waiting 2.0 seconds

as things progress.  Logically these messages are really related to
whatever called them, more than "openstack.iterate_timeout".  For
logging hierarchy purposes you'd prefer for it to be captured with its
parent, as it is indicating a loop happening there.

Add a parent argument to setup_logging that will indicate to register
the new logger as a child of this.

Use this argument in the util.iterate_timeout call

Plumb in some existing loggers as parents for most of the
iterate_timeout calls.

Change-Id: Ibc3afe21e8987b54f1de68bde5c9f1a30201304f

commit_message:
[WIP] handle fedora27 python3 changes

with fedora27, python3 has started installing pip things into
/usr/local.  This means we don't have to work-around overwriting the
system copies.

Change-Id: I046c607c2c0966f102d47f81ff3e053c0a84fece

[{'created': '2017-05-04 00:20:11.000000000', 'message': "Journal logging format: iso timestamp & no hostname

Use an ISO timestamp for sanity

Don't log the hostname.  We already stamp this into the logs (so you
can see what provider you're running on) but it's too much noise on
every line.

Change-Id: I185d12eef5fbbba39b49953797ca11cd0f6d0e5e
"}, {'created': '2017-05-04 02:32:54.000000000', 'message': "Journal logging format: no hostname

Don't log the hostname.  We already stamp this into the logs (so you
can see what provider you're running on) but it's too much noise on
every line.

Change-Id: I185d12eef5fbbba39b49953797ca11cd0f6d0e5e
"}]
commit_message:
Journal logging format: no hostname

Don't log the hostname.  We already stamp this into the logs (so you
can see what provider you're running on) but it's too much noise on
every line.

Change-Id: I185d12eef5fbbba39b49953797ca11cd0f6d0e5e

subject: Bail on common devuser usernames
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10035, 'name': 'greghaynes', 'email': 'greg@greghaynes.net', 'username': 'greghaynes'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 21741, 'name': 'Andreas Florath', 'email': 'andreas@florath.net', 'username': 'florath'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-04-24 08:45:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10035, 'date': '2018-04-25 16:26:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think there's a valid use case of wanting to create these users when using an image without cloud-init. What do you think about just complaining loudly and adding docs in the README about this? Alternatively, we could add a --force type argument you have to specify.

I also am starting to think that devuser is moving a bit beyond its original use case - the intent was to just ease development, if were starting to work around integration issues it may be time to think of a more full fledged 'add-users' element."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-05-16 01:18:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I think there's a valid use case of wanting to create these users when using an image without cloud-init. 

Yeah, but as you say it's supposed to just be for a development user, something to help you debug things while you figure out networking issues, etc.  

So that's basically "hey, I was using devuser to create a ubuntu user on the system because I know I don't have cloud-init and I want a default username like it" versus "I'm new to all this, and I know cloud images have a ubuntu user, and that seems like what i want to be my devuser" (which is basically what happened).

IMO it would be to avoid a repeat of the later, at the expense of the former'}, {'account_id': 28208, 'date': '2018-05-17 09:39:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> we should check if there is already a user with the same name, because that is confusing
I wouldn't 'exit 1', because
1) actual code does what is it intended to do - adds user
2) we would need to track which standard or non-standard users are added to images and cloud-init, which adds additional work

I would suggest to:
1) echo Warning message "Warning: user $DIB_DEV_USER_USERNAME could be overridden in standard image from vendor.", and
2) document it in README'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-05-18 05:56:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yeah, dib has so much output, often of a very confusing nature, that warnings have been shown to not help much if at all.

TBH the concerns seem a bit theoretical -- there is a potential corner case of an experienced person doing this by choice, but we also have an actual case of a new user wasting a significant amount of time debugging things in the wrong place due to this.'}, {'account_id': 28208, 'date': '2018-05-18 08:07:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Then I would just document it in devuser/README, but still not fail with 'exit 1'.

As a user I start with 'User Guise -> Building An Image", with very basic example like 'disk-image-create ubuntu vm', and then add command line options one after another.

If user went deep to start using DIB_DEV_USER_USERNAME option, then she/he should:
1) understand that there was a user created even w/o that option and think where does it come from
2) have read devuser/README about DIB_DEV_USER_USERNAME option, which is a good place to warn about cloud-init potentially overriding user

And I would expect from people who use cloud infrastructure to know about cloud-init (another question is whether base image maintainers document properly content and behavior of their standard cloud images, cloud-init usage in particular).'}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2019-06-16 07:28:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

IMHO Greg hit the point here.
It is mostly impossible to provide a list of all usernames which later might be added  - like the ones you already mentioned 'ubuntu' and 'centos' but also usernames like 'fedora'.
Also I have no clue what happens if a system username is used like 'root', 'nobody', 'mail', 'sshd' or 'daemon'. Theoretically you also need to sort them out.
The devuser element is nothing a 'normal' or new user should use - and IMHO a hint in the documentation should be enough."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-12-17 05:13:58.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-24 08:45:10.000000000', 'message': "Bail on common devuser usernames

Using DIB_DEV_UESR_USERNAME=ubuntu caused a great deal of confusion,
because cloud-init can possibly come along and take over the username,
locking you out of password access and leaving us wondering why the
element didn't work.

Let's just enforce using a different username to avoid anyone else
wasting time with this.

Change-Id: Iae34f9dfbd34e592a3b64fb20e7104110739e623
Closes-Bug: #1766228
"}]
commit_message:
Bail on common devuser usernames

Using DIB_DEV_UESR_USERNAME=ubuntu caused a great deal of confusion,
because cloud-init can possibly come along and take over the username,
locking you out of password access and leaving us wondering why the
element didn't work.

Let's just enforce using a different username to avoid anyone else
wasting time with this.

Change-Id: Iae34f9dfbd34e592a3b64fb20e7104110739e623
Closes-Bug: #1766228

commit_message:
Increase backoffLimit to 10 for helm installer

The helm installer often quickly reaches the backoffLimit of 5. Increase
this to 10 so that there is a greater chance of successful installation.

Story: 2006765
Task: 37783

Change-Id: I5293c970bb1696f14c421fdf67abb495b4b8d666
Signed-off-by: Bharat Kunwar <brtknr@bath.edu>

[{'created': '2017-11-29 23:16:37.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Fix #1627402: fix grub2 element for ubuntu xenial"

This reverts commit 003fc17208e645b453ccb7c7ad27d332bdae490c.

It seems this special handling is still needed.  The following command
fails with the error of:

 $ disk-image-create -o ubuntu.qcow2 ubuntu grub2

 "/usr/sbin/grub-probe: error: cannot find a device for / (is /dev mounted?)"

I also confirmed that reverting this change (adding the special

Change-Id: Ieb828a7861249044ce0ed1eb36d089d81992efd0

commit_message:
Revert "Fix #1627402: fix grub2 element for ubuntu xenial"

This reverts commit 003fc17208e645b453ccb7c7ad27d332bdae490c.

It seems this special handling is still needed.  The following command
fails with the error of:

 $ disk-image-create -o ubuntu.qcow2 ubuntu grub2
 ...
 "/usr/sbin/grub-probe: error: cannot find a device for / (is /dev mounted?)"

I also confirmed that reverting this change (adding the special
handling back) fixes the image building.

Change-Id: Ieb828a7861249044ce0ed1eb36d089d81992efd0

commit_message:
Use pip list for saved output

With zuulv3 cloning, "pip freeze" doesn't show useful values for repo
installs as they don't have a remote.  Devstack switched to using "pip
list" in I33d25f86b6afcadb4b190a0f6c53311111c64521; do the same here
and also update the help page.

Change-Id: Id30cae9539b796dde51e4ea1834d4247e4b134da

commit_message:
Ansiblise ephemeral/swap setup

Move the "fix_disk_layout" role from a big shell script to ansible
steps.

(Requires Ansible 2.3 for the parted module)

Depends-On: I2a59e22a38918ae45e0518b0af85ad6e8bc9423c
Change-Id: Icd4e6d8ab84471ad06e69c3e0f9bac92776efc78

neat!'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2014-10-27 20:51:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Ok, thinking over the UX a bit. 

I think we need this to be discoverable from the logs pages, so we need some link to (download all logs). 

I also think probably we should do something like use content-type=zip... or the like and use that as the switch instead of the path switch.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2014-10-27 23:59:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I think we need this to be discoverable from the logs pages, so we need some link to (download all logs).

Agree, but I think we should do that separately after we've tested it out manually in the production environment for a bit.

> I also think probably we should do something like use content-type=zip... or the like and use that as the switch instead of the path switch.

just to be clear, you're saying the url would be

  http://logs.openstack.org/26/118226/1/gate/gate-grenade-dsvm/fb63ac0?content-type=zip

i don't know if it makes much difference; i feel like the current way sits alongside the /htmlify option fairly logically.  it's very minor, but '?' and '&' are always annoying for wget users on the command-line; a use-case that i imagine would be very common"}, {'account_id': 7069, 'date': '2014-11-26 11:13:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I think the main point is that /htmilfy/ isn't exposed to the user in our deployment (it is rewriten with apache rules).

We have crude support for query params such as '?source=swift' so having something like a content type would make some sense here.

I'm okay with this as an intermediate step, but have you given any thought to how this may look for logs stored in swift?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-20 17:09:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-19 06:03:40.000000000', 'message': "Add ability to download log bundles

TODO : finish test-cases

This change provides a small additional wsgi application to download a
tarball of logs for a single test run.

The idea is for a modified URL such as

  http://logs.openstack.org/download/26/118226/1/gate/gate-grenade-dsvm/fb63ac0/

to initiate a download of a file called
118226_1_gate-grenade-dsvm_fb63ac0.tar.gz which includes a copy of all
logs for the test.

There are many way to skin this cat.  To explain some of the choices

 - the existing log-analyze stuff happens via a wsgi app, so follow
   that lead to avoid any other dependencies

 - The logs are compressed to a temporary file which is streamed back
   via wsgi.  This allows us to set the content-length correctly so
   you get what looks like a normal download, and wsgi streams the
   large file efficiently.

 - log packages are around 7MiB from my testing.  This is big but not
   ridiculous.

 - The risk I can see here is if a unfriendly spider decided to
   request every download it possibly could.  In this case, the script
   would start returning 500 errors when it could not create the
   archive.  Due to the existing way we uncompress files for sending,
   a recursive wget (ignoring robots.txt) would be much harder on the
   server than this would be and that doesn't seem to be a problem at
   the moment (people probably do this now to get access to all the
   logs quickly).  We could partition it to use a separate temp space
   if there is a problem.

 - Probably the best alternative is ZipStream [1].  Several issues:
   the pypi version seems to come from a forked source [2], it's a
   .zip, which isn't super-unixy, we don't know the content-length so
   we get no progress.  Given this and the size of the log packages, I
   don't think it is worth extra complexity.

 - The log link can be provided in the readme stuff that gets
   displayed with the logs when it is active

[1] https://github.com/SpiderOak/ZipStream
[2] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/zipstream

Change-Id: I6741d2514ae9cfef604243b9ce7063817be1ba3a
"}, {'created': '2014-09-23 01:58:48.000000000', 'message': "Add ability to download log bundles

   server than this would be and that doesn't seem to be a problem at

   if there is a problem.

 - Probably the best alternative is ZipStream [1].  Several issues:
   the pypi version seems to come from a forked source [2], it's a
   .zip, which isn't super-unixy, we don't know the content-length so
   we get no progress.  Given this and the size of the log packages, I
   don't think it this is a better approach for now.

 - The log link can be provided in the readme stuff that gets

commit_message:
Add ability to download log bundles

This change provides a small additional wsgi application to download a
tarball of logs for a single test run and related test-cases.

The idea is for a modified URL such as

  http://logs.openstack.org/download/26/118226/1/gate/gate-grenade-dsvm/fb63ac0/

to initiate a download of a file called
118226_1_gate-grenade-dsvm_fb63ac0.tar.gz which includes a copy of all
logs for the test.

There are many way to skin this cat.  To explain some of the choices

 - The logs are compressed to a temporary file which is streamed back
   via wsgi.  This allows us to set the content-length correctly so
   you get what looks like a normal download, and wsgi streams the
   large file efficiently.

 - log packages are around 7MiB from my testing.  This is big but not
   ridiculous.

 - The risk I can see here is if a unfriendly spider decided to
   request every download it possibly could.  In this case, the script
   would start returning 500 errors when it could not create the
   archive.  Due to the existing way we uncompress files for sending,
   a recursive wget (ignoring robots.txt) would be much harder on the
   server than this would be and that doesn't seem to be a problem at
   the moment (people probably do this now to get access to all the
   logs quickly).  We could partition it to use a separate temp space
   if there is a problem.

 - Probably the best alternative is ZipStream [1].  Several issues:
   the pypi version seems to come from a forked source [2], it's a
   .zip, which isn't super-unixy, we don't know the content-length so
   we get no progress.  Given this and the size of the log packages, I
   don't think it this is a better approach for now.

 - The log link can be provided in the readme stuff that gets
   displayed with the logs when this is active

[1] https://github.com/SpiderOak/ZipStream
[2] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/zipstream

Change-Id: I6741d2514ae9cfef604243b9ce7063817be1ba3a

Add sentinel file to devstack cache directory to prevent devstack runs
trying to download images during test runs.  Test images will need to
be added to the cache before they can be used (see

commit_message:
Add devstack no-download sentinel

Add sentinel file to devstack cache directory to prevent devstack runs
trying to download images during test runs.  Test images will need to
be added to the cache before they can be used (see
I7db026ad20f30b457522fbffd8e0a90787d69a99)

Change-Id: I23cdeb6757e2a633b634b6db7353acb8122e4745
Depends-On: Iace57fd0042c35535e72a3b316ea594516968113

commit_message:
Add chrony time sync, small refactor

Switch the time sync to preferring chrony if the client is installed.
While we are here, refactor this slightly into the setup function
(rather than the timer start function) as it seems more like a
"setupy" thing to be doing.

See also I5e524588417c37691b9c1f6a2d3dccdb1f2340c8 for chrony install
on system-config

Change-Id: I4d827bd6761ac7e9359a0ec2a9f803c52becc859

subject: Run external_post_deploy_tasks at every step
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

[{'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-12-09 19:23:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-12-09 19:26:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-12-09 21:29:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-12-09 21:39:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-12-10 12:31:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-12-10 12:35:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

WIP for now, I need to rewrite this patch to make it so the tasks run only of the step exists so it's less expensive to run."}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2019-12-10 12:36:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I think we need to find a different way.

We keep adding additional tasks at every step and that is proving to be very costly. I know this patch doesn't add any, but you are adding the interface to do so. Our performance at scale right now is pretty poor due to the amount of time ansible spends just skipping tasks.

At the very least, you need to change the interface to specify the tasks per step in the templates instead of using "when: step==X". Then write out the tasks files per step in config-download. Then only run the tasks for that step *if* a file exists. You'll also need to switch to include_tasks, and add a when condition on if the file exists. That way, ansible can easily skip including the whole task file at once.

For example, in the templates, you'd do:

external_post_deploy_tasks:
  step_5:
    - name: The task list...
    - name: another task...

Then have config-download write out:

external_post_deploy_tasks_step5.yaml, etc.

Then have the playbook only include_tasks from external_post_deploy_tasks_step5.yaml if the file exists.

Fwiw, I'm also looking at making this change for deploy_step_tasks to help performance, however that will be much more challenging since we already have the interface for that well established, so we'll have to parse the tasks for the step in config-download.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-12-10 13:38:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-12-10 16:13:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-12-10 18:36:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(4 comments)

couple of nits.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-12-10 19:53:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-12-12 17:40:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Workflow-1

WIP now, I'll try to abandon this patch and not needed it"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-12-17 03:09:54.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

not needed anymore'}]

[{'created': '2019-12-09 19:23:43.000000000', 'message': 'Run external_post_deploy_tasks at every step

This patch allows the external_post_deploy_tasks to run at every step.
Before, the ansible tasks were only executed at the very end of the
deployment, but this interface can be useful to be also run after the
containers are deployed for each step.

This can be easily done by running external_post_deploy_tasks at every
step.

once the Keystone container is up.

commit_message:
Run external_post_deploy_tasks at every step

This patch allows the external_post_deploy_tasks to run at every step.
Before, the ansible tasks were only executed at the very end of the
deployment, but this interface can be useful to be also run after the
containers are deployed for each step.

This can be done by running external_post_deploy_tasks at every step.

Note 1: for the existing tasks, force the step to be 5 as it used to be
run after the step 5 (nova-az and nova-compute). The result will be the
same.

Note 2: "Server Post Deployments" task will be executed *after* the
external_post_deploy_tasks of step 5 (instead of before); but it
shouldn't change anything for the deployment.

Note 3: It's using a new way of running tasks where it only include the
tasks if they exist for that role AND for the step; so we don't waste
time including skipped tasks.

After this patch, this interface will be used to create the keystone
resources (endpoints, users, etc) with Ansible at the end of the step 3,
once the Keystone container is up.

Depends-On: I7dc5e9c67952c08d68fcd59f7fd103d35b5dc279
Change-Id: I5319097f16358673c6cee0d8a39e6d98cf7a873b

commit_message:
Add external_post_deploy_tasks to constants.PER_STEP_TASKS

We're converting external_post_deploy_tasks to be executed per step in
THT; so let's add it to the list of PER_STEP_TASKS in constants.

Change-Id: I7dc5e9c67952c08d68fcd59f7fd103d35b5dc279

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-11 04:40:07.000000000', 'message': 'GUI hangs on creation of project in User creation form

On creation of project in user creation form, the response is sent
as html and the javascript try to parse the output as json and fails.

The project creation response should be sent as text/plain so that
javascript can parse the string as json.

The bug have 3 parts
1. Users are not listed on GUI in different domain
2. Projects are not listed on GUI in different domain
3. Gui hangs during creation of user/project using + option
Case 1 & 2 are fixed at https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697962/
This patch fixes case 3.

Change-Id: I4936a158ad99cf9d7514e79c06ed2315ce11218b
Closes-Bug: #1826114
'}]
commit_message:
GUI hangs on creation of project in User creation form

On creation of project in user creation form, the response is sent
as html and the javascript try to parse the output as json and fails.

The project creation response should be sent as text/plain so that
javascript can parse the string as json.

The bug have 3 parts
1. Users are not listed on GUI in different domain
2. Projects are not listed on GUI in different domain
3. Gui hangs during creation of user/project using + option
Case 1 & 2 are fixed at https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697962/
This patch fixes case 3.

Change-Id: I4936a158ad99cf9d7514e79c06ed2315ce11218b
Closes-Bug: #1826114

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-16 19:50:22.000000000', 'message': "Update override for keystone resources

The existing override was double quoting the override options which would
lead the config generator to double quote keys in the rendered data. This
change modifies the override data to make it use a jinja data structure
which will ensure we're not having to deal with quoting issues.

Change-Id: If3000457cb0c4fcd07082057ee801d30ff4a10e9
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Update override for keystone resources

The existing override was double quoting the override options which would
lead the config generator to double quote keys in the rendered data. This
change modifies the override data to make it use a jinja data structure
which will ensure we're not having to deal with quoting issues.

Change-Id: If3000457cb0c4fcd07082057ee801d30ff4a10e9
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
docs: use openstackdocstheme extlink extension

The extlink extension [1] ensures the urls have version-specific
references to other projects.

commit_message:
Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

python-ironicclient is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

Change-Id: Iacc50fde00f0d24e9c6ee2b1ac61b8fa060094fb

commit_message:
Pass on missing implementation while filtering

The in_() filter isn't implemented yet for relations. Since these are
being used in multiple locations in order to add new attributes to
objects, we ignore the resulting error and allow the filtering to be
applied by the corresponding result_filter hook afterwards.

Change-Id: Ie91656387f7a7e60738a63bc28bf9bd505407cff
Partial-Bug: 1818318

commit_message:
Set containerized_undercloud to false

Feature set 047 is the non-containerized upgrade featureset. We need to
explicitly configure containerized_undercloud to false because in Rocky,
it's set to true by default.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/698963/
Change-Id: I720088bfb1a49d28305b1dca3d8743c6e77a7048

Checking for physical_host_group could make this patch work for

backport it that far.

Change-Id: I6bb24a8719b3902d6f510c70705cdb63076a1a08

(cherry picked from commit edf0a25ca2e78658f06a2394a4ded60b49232bca)

commit_message:
l3 agent on network_hosts do dvr_snat, anywhere else dvr

With the change in queens of moving the neutron agents from
containers onto the network_hosts, if those hosts happen to
also be your nova_computes, VM's without a floating ip would
lose north/south network.

Checking for physical_host_group could make this patch work for
neutron_agents_containers on pike aswell, if we want to
backport it that far.

Change-Id: I6bb24a8719b3902d6f510c70705cdb63076a1a08
Signed-off-by: Erik Berg <openstack@slipsprogrammor.no>
(cherry picked from commit edf0a25ca2e78658f06a2394a4ded60b49232bca)

'}, {'created': '2019-10-25 00:07:19.000000000', 'message': 'Block ability update callback_url

  cleaning, rescue networks.
* Insight about a node, such as a MAC address, or baremetal node

Can submit an erroneous ``heartbeat`` to the ironic-api endpoint
with a ``callback_url`` that is not of the actual intended agent.
This can potentially cause a rescue, cleaning, or deployment
operation to be derailed, or at worst commands to be sent to
to an endpoint the malicious user controls.

commit_message:
Block ability update callback_url

A malicious user with:

* API access normally reserved for the provisioning,
  cleaning, rescue networks.
* Insight about a node, such as a MAC address, or baremetal node
  UUID.
* Insight into the state of the node, such as the access provided
  to Compute API users, or other Bare Metal API users.

Can submit an erroneous ``heartbeat`` to the ironic-api endpoint
with a ``callback_url`` that is not of the actual intended agent.
This can potentially cause a rescue, cleaning, or deployment
operation to be derailed, or at worst commands to be sent to
to an endpoint the malicious user controls.

Story: 2006773
Task: 37295
Change-Id: I1a5e3c2b34d45c06fb74e82d0f30735ce9041914

commit_message:
Nova: add net-tools package

This PS adds the net-tools package to the nova image, required for
the 'route' command.

Addtionailly voting is turned off for opensuse openstack image builds,
untill we can break out the package name definition between distros.

Change-Id: I74ed18620de33a2af2aac6b8719bbbcc925685da
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Remove the deprecated project_id attribute of the POST method

The project_id attribute of the POST method on the following objects
has been deprecated and removed: listener, pool, health monitor,
l7policy, l7rule and member.These objects will use the parent
load balancer's project_id.

Change-Id: I73592b68543e8cda634bf0484589a9eb3d463454

commit_message:
Remove configuration option 'amp_ssh_access_allowed'

The deprecated configuration 'amp_ssh_access_allowed' has been
removed.This option and 'amp_ssh_key_name'overlap in functionality,
and only one is needed.Use 'amp_ssh_key_name' instead.

Change-Id: I6b54be655dd379171dd80151cf41c0d8a2e189c1

commit_message:
Enable healthcheck script in clustercheck service

The clustercheck container uses the same container image as the mysql
service. That image already contains a healthcheck script that can
monitor either mysql or clustercheck. So we can enable healthcheck
in the clustercheck service as well.

Change-Id: I36602a20822b5544e8c1cd2aa0d8ae4a84de1c6e
Closes-Bug: #1856085

[{'created': '2019-12-16 14:18:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix use of urlparse.urljoin

This method only joins the first two parameters, the 3rd parameter
is a bool "allow_fragments". Passing in "object_name" as the third
param resulted in it getting lost. Use os.path.join instead.

Change-Id: I49506b2671465bf43ae346225919d4a0e6767b20
(cherry picked from commit 59e766b3fd02f419af07a9ff85fcafbee1e6b9d5)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix use of urlparse.urljoin

This method only joins the first two parameters, the 3rd parameter
is a bool "allow_fragments". Passing in "object_name" as the third
param resulted in it getting lost. Use os.path.join instead.

Change-Id: I49506b2671465bf43ae346225919d4a0e6767b20
(cherry picked from commit 59e766b3fd02f419af07a9ff85fcafbee1e6b9d5)

commit_message:
Revert "Configure UC rocky upgrade vars"

This reverts commit 5589386151d268a2a74fd481c1420cefc66d57dd.

This was wrong since fs047 is for the *non* containerized
undercloud it should not be dynamic based on the version.

Change-Id: I9d5816b99c00a7afb890d1cb3facf8be73d92667
