commit_message:
Update: Ensure parallel execution

In middle of Queens and Rocky release we introduced option to
set parallel execution of minor update on selected role types.
If the environment went through FFWD or was deployed before this
option got backported we need to update the roles_data.

By default we have update_serial either unset at all for OSP13 and OSP14 or
we have it set where Pacemaker enabled nodes, CephOSD nodes and Networkers
have it set to 1. This is mostly defensive precaution and we do allow running
in parallel for CephOSD and Networkers for production systems that did enough
testing on preprod or can take small outage. We should also parallelize it in
CI as we just waste time here.

Change-Id: I4cff09dc6aa9ac944b20a52ae087a8923f55209f
(cherry picked from commit 2044957694d89eee9529d889859f0788767f7e28)
(cherry picked from commit ad0e9b3954a95eb19764ba7720a2649737119d49)

subject: Add a Dockerfile and related jobs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11628, 'name': 'Michael Johnson', 'email': 'johnsomor@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnsom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-11-13 04:46:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-11-13 04:58:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-11-14 03:22:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-11-14 03:39:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-11-17 11:18:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hrm.

This is a FASCINATING condundrum.

I agree - on the one hand it makes sense for the image to be zuul/dib since we're making it on behalf of nodepool.

OTOH - dib is an openstack/opendev project and isn't managed by the zuul team.

Actually - why is dib in openstack when it's an Infra deliverable? Should we be moving it to opendev/diskimage-builder?

But that said - maybe (because I love making things harder) we should put the jobs for this in system-config  and build it as opendevorg/diskimage-builder so that the ownership is more right? We already have zuul images based on opendevorg/python-base - so it's not too much of a departure. It would make updating the jobs themselves weird , but maybe that's ok?

I think we should discuss amongst the team."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-11-17 11:33:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I started writing an email about the naming and realized - I think we should jst to opendevorg/diskimage-builder. dib is owned by infra same as system-config, so I think we could encode the system-config creds just like you've done with the zuulzuul creds - and we can define and publish from here."}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-11-20 23:34:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Personally I would lean towards leaving DIB where it is in the "namespace". Does it really matter if it is in openstack/diskimage-builder for historical reasons?
I'm commenting as one of the projects that has dependencies on DIB, renaming it for renaming sake is not a great use of all of our time.
To clarify, I have no issue with how/where the docker image is named, I'm just not sure I understand the need to rename the DIB repository.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-11-21 00:31:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

sorry, haven't cycled back on this because it's at the bottom of a long stack now of trying to get nodepool-builder to work with it in a container.  Like that to work before we argue over names :)

I do agree that it's used by several openstack projects in various ways, so is probably considered an openstack project, despite it really being under infra control.  it's an odd one"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-11-21 01:38:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-11-21 03:04:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-11-26 05:50:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-11-26 05:52:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-11-27 06:01:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-11-27 22:44:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-12-16 20:49:28.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

taking a different approach'}]

commit_message:
Add a Dockerfile and related jobs

Build an OpenDev docker image for dib based on our python-builder
infrastructure.  Base it on the openstacksdk container so you have the
tools to upload images to OpenStack clouds.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/696015
Change-Id: I3f13bde568d64797f3438c576752f887240f8e5c

commit_message:
Use python -m pip instead pip command.

It's recommand to use this way. With tox is not really necessary to do
it but it can be good to use it. See this article:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

For example python -m pip executes pip using the Python interpreter
you specified as python.

Change-Id: I99ba462eb3558bb45b8143cc2d20e72f8455033f

subject: Update: Run all roles update at once
messages: [{'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-12-05 16:50:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/train.'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2019-12-10 16:40:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2019-12-16 15:13:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-05 16:50:44.000000000', 'message': 'Update: Run all roles update at once

Previously we ran role by role which is not necessary and not
intended way of production update. In case of proper testing on
preprod customers should run update as fast as possible which
means leveraging ability to run all roles at once and even all
nodes of selected roles at once. With this patch the Pacemaker
enabled roles will still update in serial but the roles will be
done in parallel. In case of 3 controller 3 database 3 messaging
setup it will look roughly like this:

Update of controller[0] database[0] messaging[0]
Update of controller[0] database[1] messaging[1]
Update of controller[1] database[2] messaging[2]
Update of controller[2]

This is due to not blocking between roles and each role taking
different amount of time to apply the update. At any moment the
pacemaker quorum is not broken.

Change-Id: Ib119210139886382726bc0ccddfdb4f7f6803015
(cherry picked from commit a2b433133de755c410d235172c0644173d17ae80)
'}]
commit_message:
Update: Run all roles update at once

Previously we ran role by role which is not necessary and not
intended way of production update. In case of proper testing on
preprod customers should run update as fast as possible which
means leveraging ability to run all roles at once and even all
nodes of selected roles at once. With this patch the Pacemaker
enabled roles will still update in serial but the roles will be
done in parallel. In case of 3 controller 3 database 3 messaging
setup it will look roughly like this:

Update of controller[0] database[0] messaging[0]
Update of controller[0] database[1] messaging[1]
Update of controller[1] database[2] messaging[2]
Update of controller[2]

This is due to not blocking between roles and each role taking
different amount of time to apply the update. At any moment the
pacemaker quorum is not broken.

Change-Id: Ib119210139886382726bc0ccddfdb4f7f6803015
(cherry picked from commit a2b433133de755c410d235172c0644173d17ae80)

subject: Revert "Nova: Update compute start script to accomodate multiple default routes"
messages:
[{'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2019-12-13 21:40:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2019-12-13 21:46:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This revert is needed because the "route" command does not exist in the nova image. So this patch is not achieving what it set out to do. In fact, it causes novnc consoles to stop working because the compute nodes don't get the proper proxy address configured. See the logs below to see the problem:

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/bb794e84c20546b09920eea6b4d910a3/log/primary/pod-logs/openstack/nova-novncproxy-68cc64f44f-7bl4w/nova-novncproxy-init.txt#9

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/bb794e84c20546b09920eea6b4d910a3/log/primary/pod-logs/openstack/nova-compute-default-d98mr/nova-compute-vnc-init.txt#10'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2019-12-16 14:39:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2019-12-16 17:04:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2019-12-16 18:20:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

what is this revert required for?'}, {'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2019-12-16 18:47:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Wouldn't it be easier to just ensure route is included as a dist package for the image build instead of reverting this change that added value (by accommodating multiple default routes)? This seems like a regression"}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2019-12-16 18:50:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

I agree with steve, the soultion here is to install route in downstream images.'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2019-12-16 20:24:52.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoned in favor of this solution: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/699280/'}]

Change-Id: Ic348e2b6be3663eecae56d3a2d9bbf5072c4be6c

commit_message:
Update neutron ovs agent for ovs-dpdk

This ps update neutron ovs agent to support properly:
- setting mtu on dpdk bond and nic interface port
- setting vhost-iommu-support on dpdk bond and nic interface port
- setting n_txq values on dpdk bond and nic interface port

Change-Id: I422fa21a622642ecb7c49914fef04073e4f984bc

commit_message:
Remove python2 from project-template

We're unwinding python2 testing. As part of doing that, remove
python2 from our zuul project-template which other people are
using to add tips jobs to their project.

Change-Id: I7d4b3f54cfd09d6a39b707f4a9a0bf4b2b9bca69

commit_message:
External Ceph: template cinder backend config when cinder_backend_ceph

Currently External Ceph Cinder config requires the user to create cinder
service custom configuration.

This change alters the if/else statements to template out cinder backends
configuration when cinder_backend_ceph is True.

Change-Id: I143c3b44d2839e56d1dbf28484c0eaae0a753dc9

extension is no longer functional.

messages:
[{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-12-16 15:55:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-12-16 18:30:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-12-16 18:54:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Looks good. Pushing through since I know the team is held up on getting this available.

"Right" answer for these things would be to stop treating a service like a library and get everything moved out into horizon-lib that is needed by plugins.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-16 15:55:58.000000000', 'message': 'Release horizon 17.1.0 (ussuri)

We bumped the default Django version to 2.2 in upper-constraints.txt
but the latest release of horizon caps the Django version to <2.2.
This leads to the situation that horizon plugins cannot install
horizon from PyPI. This is the main motivation of this release.

Change-Id: Id4f1ac6a714d709997b12a46883d575e70dff107
'}]
commit_message:
Release horizon 17.1.0 (ussuri)

We bumped the default Django version to 2.2 in upper-constraints.txt
but the latest release of horizon caps the Django version to <2.2.
This leads to the situation that horizon plugins cannot install
horizon from PyPI. This is the main motivation of this release.

Change-Id: Id4f1ac6a714d709997b12a46883d575e70dff107

I pulled this down, added a new 'foo' field to ImageMetaProps, fixed the failure in test_objects.py, ran the notification object version test and it failed as expected:

nova.tests.unit.notifications.objects.test_notification.TestNotificationObjectVersions.test_versions
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Captured traceback:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    b'Traceback (most recent call last):'
    b'  File "/home/osboxes/git/nova/nova/tests/unit/notifications/objects/test_notification.py", line 455, in test_versions'
    b"    'Some notification objects have changed; please make '"
    b'  File "/home/osboxes/git/nova/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/testtools/testcase.py", line 411, in assertEqual'
    b'    self.assertThat(observed, matcher, message)'
    b'  File "/home/osboxes/git/nova/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/testtools/testcase.py", line 498, in assertThat'
    b'    raise mismatch_error'
    b'testtools.matchers._impl.MismatchError: !=:'
    b"reference = {'ImageMetaPropsPayload': '1.3-9c200c895932163a4e14e6bb385fa1e0'}"
    b"actual    = {'ImageMetaPropsPayload': '1.3-1b5d0bc4aea65c721afded77da9baa04'}"
    b': Some notification objects have changed; please make sure the versions have been bumped, and then update their hashes here.'
    b''


As a new contributor, I'd go look at that test and that entry and see the note and should be able to figure out what to do, so this looks good to me. Especially good to have lots of comments around this kind of stuff which is easy to trip up a new contributor. And dealing with fields that have arguments sounds hairy but also low probability given the number of image properties we already have without needing arguments on those.'}]

commit_message:
DRY: Build ImageMetaPropsPayload from ImageMetaProps

ImageMetaPropsPayload (for notifications) was supposed to contain
exactly the same fields as ImageMetaProps itself; and the SCHEMA member
was those same keys in a trivially different shape. And we were having
trouble remembering to keep these two objects in sync before. So this
commit eliminates the repetition and just generates
ImageMetaPropsPayload's `fields` and `SCHEMA` from
ImageMetaProps.fields.

Change-Id: I7dc38f7f5a62098fb0c366736f27e23bd7b7ee86

(1 comment)

LGTM!

Functionally tested a rebased version (with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/698347/) on my SAIO, with

 user = vagrant

in my proxy-servers and restarting them as root. Initial start-up, things looks good:

 $ ps -e -o user,ruser,pid,cmd | grep proxy
root     root     17872 /usr/bin/python /usr/local/bin/swift-proxy-server /etc/swift/proxy-server/proxy-noauth.conf.d
root     root     17873 /usr/bin/python /usr/local/bin/swift-proxy-server /etc/swift/proxy-server/proxy-server.conf.d
vagrant  vagrant  17890 /usr/bin/python /usr/local/bin/swift-proxy-server /etc/swift/proxy-server/proxy-noauth.conf.d
vagrant  vagrant  17895 /usr/bin/python /usr/local/bin/swift-proxy-server /etc/swift/proxy-server/proxy-server.conf.d
vagrant  vagrant  17899 grep --color=auto proxy

Using the SIGUSR1 seamless reload looks good:

 $ sudo kill -USR1 17872
 $ ps -e -o user,ruser,pid,cmd | grep proxy
root     root     17872 /usr/bin/python /usr/local/bin/swift-proxy-server /etc/swift/proxy-server/proxy-noauth.conf.d
root     root     17873 /usr/bin/python /usr/local/bin/swift-proxy-server /etc/swift/proxy-server/proxy-server.conf.d
vagrant  vagrant  17895 /usr/bin/python /usr/local/bin/swift-proxy-server /etc/swift/proxy-server/proxy-server.conf.d
vagrant  vagrant  17914 /usr/bin/python /usr/local/bin/swift-proxy-server /etc/swift/proxy-server/proxy-noauth.conf.d
vagrant  vagrant  17918 grep --color=auto proxy

Backing out the change, I could see the problem:

 $ git checkout @~ -- swift
 $ sudo kill -USR1 17872
 $ ps -e -o user,ruser,pid,cmd | grep proxy
root     root     17872 /usr/bin/python /usr/local/bin/swift-proxy-server /etc/swift/proxy-server/proxy-noauth.conf.d
root     root     17873 /usr/bin/python /usr/local/bin/swift-proxy-server /etc/swift/proxy-server/proxy-server.conf.d
vagrant  vagrant  17895 /usr/bin/python /usr/local/bin/swift-proxy-server /etc/swift/proxy-server/proxy-server.conf.d
root     root     17937 /usr/bin/python /usr/local/bin/swift-proxy-server /etc/swift/proxy-server/proxy-noauth.conf.d
vagrant  vagrant  17943 grep --color=auto proxy

Don't think a bug report is strictly necessary -- sure we've had this on master for like a month, but as you point out, we haven't had a release since then."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-12-14 01:52:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-12-16 16:12:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
Update Neutron's Grafana dashboard

Recently we removed some old jobs from our check and gate queues.
We also added some new jobs related to ovn backend and some periodic
jobs.  This patch updates Neutron Grafana dashboard to be up to date
with our jobs.

Change-Id: I1d7045079490dddf80851962b232f6415e2f3e8c

I think this is kind of a special case.  According to https://www.broadcom.com/support/fibre-channel-networking/eol , Brocade customers received an EOL notice on 8 October 2019 (i.e., at Train R-1), which was too late for us to get this into the Train release.  But according to the notice they sent customers (PDF: https://docs.broadcom.com/docs/12397527), the "Brocade Support Details" for Train say:

- Supported for FOS releases up to 8.2.x
- Python 2.7 only
- Brocade driver must be marked as ‘Unsupported’ in Cinder configuration file:
  - enable_unsupported_driver=True

So their customers have already been notified that they must set enable_unsupported_driver in cinder.conf to run the driver.  I would argue that this is a bug in that Brocade forgot to set SUPPORTED = False in the driver itself.  What I'd like to do (especially since this driver is (Python 2.7 only) is to merge this to master (after adjusting the commit message and release note to reflect the above), backport it to Train, and then immediately remove the driver from master.

Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2019-12-10 14:44:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-12-11 16:12:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(5 comments)

We discussed this at today's cinder meeting [0].  We agreed that:

1. The driver should be deprecated in U since it is no longer supported by the vendor.  We will use the "subject to removal in V" language because there's some feeling that it would be bad to remove half of our FCZM drivers from the code tree.  This will give us some flexibility about the removal timeframe, yet at the same time make it clear to consumers of the driver that they need to start making plans immediately.

2. geguileo is going to address the py3 support issue by trying to test the driver under py3 and seeing what happens. When he reports back we'll have more data about the situation (because it would be really weird to have a driver that only runs under py2 as part of a cinder release that does not support running under py2).


[0] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/cinder/2019/cinder.2019-12-11-14.00.log.html#l-80'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-12-11 16:43:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-12-11 16:48:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Mark Brocade FC ZM driver unsupported

Brocade has indicated they will no longer be supporting their zone
manager driver and have requested help is getting it marked deprecated
and removed.

This marks the driver as deprecated for the Ussuri release. It us
subject to removal in the V release.

Change-Id: Ic92bd9f04f9976265e6699ddb7afa350a4081c09
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
CI: Set zuul's ansible_python_interpreter to python2

Train, Stein & Rocky only

Zuul seems to have started setting ansible_python_interpreter to python3
on Ubuntu, which breaks our installation of kolla-ansible on Train and
earlier stable branches.

This change sets ansible_python_interpreter explicitly to python2. We
use host-vars rather than vars because zuul sets a host-var for
ansible_python_interpreter=auto, which overrides vars.

Change-Id: I9ba0d16972b31a64617461461fafaf2b436e2bdf

commit_message:
Update Ceph images to Nautilus 14.2.5 packages

The Ceph package repo has been updated to include Nautilus 14.2.5
packages. This change adds comments to the Dockerfiles for all of
the Ceph images to specify the Ceph version and prompt a rebuild
of the images that will include the updated packages.

Change-Id: Ief2f29172cfa77898c438ff6bfd585b83fa55325

commit_message:
Delegate and run once debug start-at-task messages

Instead of executing these debug tasks for every host, we can delegate
them to localhost and only run them once.

Change-Id: I367db4c9e743c77f121751ecca6bb4996b8a3df9

commit_message:
[ceph-client][ceph-osd] Adjust required_percent_of_osds parameter

and incorporate in ceph-osd testing.

This parameter is used by helm test to check if a set % of OSDs
out of the total are considered in & up. Adjusting to 75% and
adding to helm-test.sh for ceph-osd along with more robust
ceph osd validation function

Change-Id: Ib1f37b901f8656f0c6f2ed6a3ec27f0357e82278

commit_message:
Ignore pep8 W503/W504

W503 has been reversed in current pep8, so we
shouldn't start enforcing this here.

W504 takes the opposite stance of W503.

Neither of these seem worth enforcing in our
code for now, just punt on a strict rule for
this and aim for readable code.

Change-Id: Id38b2629ea22792bbc7b4dce77fa9e7039be140f
(cherry picked from commit 80e37a3e6117d9b458d47de248cfad1431a62d4a)
(cherry picked from commit 61346f10029fd38613e5ae7593660405ecbac71f)

commit_message:
Update the Octavia failure rate dashboard

Change to be like the Neutron dashboard with both failure rate
and number of jobs run per section.  This will allow us to
better understand how the Octavia jobs are running over time.

commit_message:
fix get the name servers for a zone not validate zone_id

now the api of get /v2/zones/{zone_id}/nameservers not validate zone_id,
if set zone_id contain spaces, will trigger DBError and return 500.

Change-Id: Ia3e07c42dc548207aa7ff9efcc35a215c9660e54
(cherry picked from commit 0ba52bfb62cb64992a06b64c44f3e6a9dcadc193)

Update Neutron failure rate dashboard

We no longer run the py35 jobs, and the coverage job is not run
in the gate, so neither shows-up on the grafana page, remove them.

Change-Id: Ibfc39a89cf8225e3c8772326893cd66e43acd054

commit_message:
Support configuration of Docker client timeout

Adds support for configuration of the Docker client timeout via
'docker_client_timeout'.

This change also increases the default timeout to 120 seconds, as we
sometimes see timeouts in CI and heavily loaded or underpowered
environments. Increasing 'docker_client_timeout' further may be helpful
in cases where Docker reports 'Read timed out'.

Change-Id: I73745771078cb2c0ebae2b1d87ba2c4c12958d82
Closes-Bug: #1809844
(cherry picked from commit 01050dc01fa8558eb453c48faa2a8efd398c5367)

commit_message:
Refactor _gen_resource_inventory

This refactors _gen_resource_inventory as suggested in [1], simplifying
by removing unused fields which duplicated defaults that are set by
placement itself.

This patch introduces the previously absent test suite for conductor
manager.

[1] I0aac84a1fc6b00b5523927bee27f7491daecd786

Change-Id: I79379f55f3ea0690c58a7835d1e8c31117245626

commit_message:
improve JSON examples for PCI Passthrough config

Breaks up an example section of the README.md dealing with
pci-passthrough-whitelist in such a way that syntax-highlighting of
example yaml blocks are easily copiable.  Also, resolves an issue
with the example for multiple whitelisted devices by removing a
trailing tick (`).

Change-Id: I3ecd01957efa10e240bebb16dde33b0bd6347ef9

commit_message:
Fix openstack release in gates

Change I7def8df68371deda0b75a685363c8a73b818dd45 removed one
line by mistake passing the openstack release var down to the zuul
jobs, so all jobs are currently running under ocata.

This patch restores the missing line, thus fixing the opensuse jobs
and making sure the other jobs run under the correct release.

Change-Id: Ia7a488928e521de1afb821f141d77d2b0268ff0a

commit_message:
Template custom HAProxy service configuration

Change Id84e3b6e62e544582d6917047534e846e026798d added support for
custom HAProxy service config using a plain copy of files in services.d.

Use a template action instead of a copy so that we can use variables and
iterate over group of hosts.

Change-Id: I1f07785932de4e4540422bd18af95241f05a67bf
(cherry picked from commit 49f334284b2b61f748c32eb434ddbb48bc9d6e59)

messages:
[{'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2019-11-06 09:16:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-11-06 09:17:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-11-07 14:12:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Install texttable and harmonize the way to install.

Fix the import during the documentation build. The module is required to
generate the file feature-configuration-generated. Add a documentation
requirement file and use the sphinx-build command to build the
documentation.

Change-Id: Ia64d4edc43efcc21f4de656a89c1748fb889ba70

commit_message:
Add Debian/source aarch64 CI job

AArch64 is getting popular and not all changes working on x86-64 work
properly on aarch64 architecture. Let check them.

Job is running in separate pipeline due to low number of aarch64 nodes.

Authored-By: Xinliang Liu <xinliang.liu@linaro.org>
Co-Authored-By: Jeffrey Zhang <zhang.lei.fly@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Marcin Juszkiewicz <marcin.juszkiewicz@linaro.org>

Implements: blueprint aarch64-3rd-party-ci-kolla

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/698606

Change-Id: I7e7802dfa4f4d9c61d01dba4b77c01cfb24301c0

commit_message:
Make SUSE job non-voting

Recent changes caused Apache to fail to start properly in
the SUSE job. This patch set temporarily makes them non-
voting to unblock other patches until a more permanent fix
is in place.

Change-Id: I7cbd45b8b761d921473869223bdafd0200723a64
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tlam@omegaprime.dev>

commit_message:
[Gate] Fix missing environment variable

The OpenStack Helm gate is currently broken because an environment
variable used by the feature gate was removed in [0].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/commit/3a6df3b544beec21805165da115b4a01a15e917c#diff-405f4dc50adbdfb36566bed46a67718e

Change-Id: Ib612da3d5901338dee863eba610874db91f7fb37
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

subject: Uncap django
messages:
[{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-12-06 03:29:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-12-06 03:30:08.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to django'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-12-06 06:54:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-12-06 12:41:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.

Thanks! Apparently, I was too rushed. :)'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-12-06 15:46:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Thanks, LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-12-09 11:49:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-12-13 03:55:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck.'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-12-13 08:26:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck.'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-12-13 11:49:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2019-12-14 15:40:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think we need a new release of horizon that contains this patch. Right now, zun-ui job failed with the following error:

2019-12-14 15:28:57.242996 | ubuntu-bionic |     raise VersionConflict(dist, req).with_context(dependent_req)
2019-12-14 15:28:57.243004 | ubuntu-bionic | pip._vendor.pkg_resources.ContextualVersionConflict: (Django 2.2 (/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/zun-ui/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages), Requirement.parse('Django<2.1,>=1.11; python_version >= "3.0"'), {'horizon'})'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-12-16 15:53:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Precisely speaking, this change has no side effect.
The reason of zun-ui failure is caused by https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697431/.
horizon is used as a library, so we first need to cut a release of horizon and then bump Django in u-c.'}]

commit_message:
Release sushy for Ussuri milestone 1

This picks up unreleased changes in sushy.
The cycle-with-intermediary deliverables are good to release frequently
whenever there are functional changes to be released. Feel free to -1
this patch if there are additional changes that should be included in
this release or if it is not a good time to do it.

Change-Id: I01944f968bab7b8c3e55135a93d32a3661fced50
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Configure UC rocky upgrade vars

We are using fs47 to run the UC upgrade without containers.
This should change depending on the version.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/698225
Closes-Bug: #1855856

Change-Id: Iae6d1a331e55b5f56f667e7bf84d79bf7e01f3c6

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-13 16:39:16.000000000', 'message': "Fix upgrades from older (<=10.1) MariaDB releases

Due to old row format pre-upgrade some current migrations
may fail to apply.
In Train this affects only Ubuntu.
This patch runs a script to change all row formats to DYNAMIC
which is the default in recent MariaDB releases.

This patch incorporates the following change to pass CI:

CI: Set zuul's ansible_python_interpreter to python2

Train, Stein & Rocky only

Zuul seems to have started setting ansible_python_interpreter to python3
on Ubuntu, which breaks our installation of kolla-ansible on Train and
earlier stable branches.

This change sets ansible_python_interpreter explicitly to python2. We
use host-vars rather than vars because zuul sets a host-var for
ansible_python_interpreter=auto, which overrides vars.

I9ba0d16972b31a64617461461fafaf2b436e2bdf by Mark Goddard

Change-Id: I3b39ec8d733b52a13cbc22b6f426b000584bab9d
Closes-bug: #1856296
"}, {'created': '2019-12-13 16:47:08.000000000', 'message': "Fix upgrades from older (<=10.1) MariaDB releases

commit_message:
Fix upgrades from older (<=10.1) MariaDB releases

Due to old row format pre-upgrade some current migrations
may fail to apply.
In Train this affects only Ubuntu.
This patch runs a script to change all row formats to DYNAMIC
which is the default in recent MariaDB releases.

This patch incorporates the following change to pass CI:

CI: Set zuul's ansible_python_interpreter to python2

Train, Stein & Rocky only

Zuul seems to have started setting ansible_python_interpreter to python3
on Ubuntu, which breaks our installation of kolla-ansible on Train and
earlier stable branches.

This change sets ansible_python_interpreter explicitly to python2. We
use host-vars rather than vars because zuul sets a host-var for
ansible_python_interpreter=auto, which overrides vars.

I9ba0d16972b31a64617461461fafaf2b436e2bdf by Mark Goddard

Change-Id: I3b39ec8d733b52a13cbc22b6f426b000584bab9d
Closes-bug: #1856296

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-11 13:21:06.000000000', 'message': "Include dnsmasq-utils package on all Ubuntu versions

This package provides dhcp_release tool but in files/debs/neutron-common
it was listed to be installed only on Ubuntu Precise.
The same file is also in Nova's packages but there is no restriction to
Ubuntu Precise only there.
So on all Neutron jobs it was fine but on Ironic's job where Nova
wasn't enabled, this package was not installed and caused problems
in Neutron DHCP agent.

Change-Id: Idd0711cfe6d43f21754a2f0c230cd094ea33cb27
Closes-Bug: #1855910
(cherry picked from commit f7a7076facbe8ef7c77863abf977af5cdafdeb6e)
"}]
commit_message:
Include dnsmasq-utils package on all Ubuntu versions

This package provides dhcp_release tool but in files/debs/neutron-common
it was listed to be installed only on Ubuntu Precise.
The same file is also in Nova's packages but there is no restriction to
Ubuntu Precise only there.
So on all Neutron jobs it was fine but on Ironic's job where Nova
wasn't enabled, this package was not installed and caused problems
in Neutron DHCP agent.

Change-Id: Idd0711cfe6d43f21754a2f0c230cd094ea33cb27
Closes-Bug: #1855910
(cherry picked from commit f7a7076facbe8ef7c77863abf977af5cdafdeb6e)

commit_message:
Remove option status_update_threads

The deprecated configuration option 'status_update_threads' has
been removed.'health_update_threads' and 'stats_update_threads'
should be used instead.

Change-Id: If181d7defa619ca66129025b8e94243eade28bf2

[{'created': '2019-12-12 15:16:05.000000000', 'message': 'Fix use of urlparse.urljoin

This method only joins the first two parameters, the 3rd parameter
is a bool "allow_fragments". Passing in "object_name" as the third
param resulted in it getting lost. Use os.path.join instead to
join the path part of the URL.

Change-Id: I49506b2671465bf43ae346225919d4a0e6767b20
'}, {'created': '2019-12-12 20:52:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix use of urlparse.urljoin

This method only joins the first two parameters, the 3rd parameter
is a bool "allow_fragments". Passing in "object_name" as the third
param resulted in it getting lost. Use os.path.join instead.

Change-Id: I49506b2671465bf43ae346225919d4a0e6767b20
'}]
commit_message:
Fix use of urlparse.urljoin

This method only joins the first two parameters, the 3rd parameter
is a bool "allow_fragments". Passing in "object_name" as the third
param resulted in it getting lost. Use os.path.join instead.

Change-Id: I49506b2671465bf43ae346225919d4a0e6767b20

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-21 09:29:35.000000000', 'message': "Remove the TripleO standalone job

Despite the comment in .zuul.yaml this job actually doesn't use Mistral.
It is installed, but not used. This can be seen in the Mistral logs
which have minimal output (other than that of the workbooks being
loaded).

https://c867b5a19c86ae8c3ab7-a51f273e08e05c861a2fa6ace8476176.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/695212/2/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario003-standalone/4827980/logs/undercloud/var/log/containers/mistral/

Th other TripleO job also covers this case and then uses Mistral. This
patch removes the job which has been wasting resources for quite some
time now.

Change-Id: Ie3381c7226d50591192ae61697bdb0d134ddf4f1
"}]
commit_message:
Remove the TripleO standalone job

Despite the comment in .zuul.yaml this job actually doesn't use Mistral.
It is installed, but not used. This can be seen in the Mistral logs
which have minimal output (other than that of the workbooks being
loaded).

https://c867b5a19c86ae8c3ab7-a51f273e08e05c861a2fa6ace8476176.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/695212/2/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario003-standalone/4827980/logs/undercloud/var/log/containers/mistral/

Th other TripleO job also covers this case and then uses Mistral. This
patch removes the job which has been wasting resources for quite some
time now.

Change-Id: Ie3381c7226d50591192ae61697bdb0d134ddf4f1

commit_message:
Disable ExternalVipPort when deploying cell-compute

Compute cell stack does not require VIP ports in external
networks. Without this the stack creation fails since
most porbably the IP is already in use in multi cell
environment.

Change-Id: Ic3c8db1b3e96c3923d781de006780d236e361f48

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-12-13 09:04:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-12-16 12:22:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19:

(1 comment)

Sorry I didn't review sooner.

The shell grepping and piping can be a bit error prone, so I might have gone for python but hopefully it will fine."}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-12-16 13:14:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Sorry I didn't review sooner.
 > 
 > The shell grepping and piping can be a bit error prone, so I might
 > have gone for python but hopefully it will fine.

So - Docker Engine today does not have the capabilities to restart images based on their health status. So the statuses are purely informational - there's a custom docker image/script to restart docker containers based on health status. Here is some long running conversation on GitHub why Docker Engine is not doing that: https://github.com/moby/moby/issues/28400. TripleO is using it this way, so I don't think we need to improve it - but happy to do it based on some bug reports ;-)"}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-12-16 13:16:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

(1 comment)'}]

commit_message:
Build images with healthcheck scripts for core services

blueprint container-health-check

Now docker supports healthcheck directive[0] in Dockerfile,
which is helpful for checking container aliveness.

Base for this patch were healthcheck scripts from tripleo[1].

[0] https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/builder/#healthcheck
[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/tree/master/healthcheck

Change-Id: Ifc32713cd4d6b45c74855c0ebf5bb65784701d44

commit_message:
Remove xtrace alteration in devstack/plugin.sh

Xtrace is enabled by default, but this pluging hook file disables it
making hard to debug plugin failures.

For understanding what is failing in devstack plugin xtraces are
required. Therefore this change is intended to leave xtrace options as
set by DevStack, that means enabled.

xtraces should be disabled only locally by stable functions that are
called too many times and filling log files of too verbose outputs.

Change-Id: I9d48fb4420c322badb9c811dccf826f7f2a66d2d

subject: Set ubuntu-bionic as default nodeset image
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-13 10:09:45.000000000', 'message': 'Set ubuntu-bionic as default nodeset image

After support for Ubuntu Xenial has been drop, must switch
from ubuntu-xeanial to ubuntu-bionic default images for
default nodesets.

This is intended to fix jobs that are using DevStack
without caring about the version of the nodeset image
after below change broke them:

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695114/

Change-Id: I02c46773c1f640d3d37ddcf813ed9106fbdfc67a
'}]
commit_message:
Set ubuntu-bionic as default nodeset image

After support for Ubuntu Xenial has been drop, must switch
from ubuntu-xeanial to ubuntu-bionic default images for
default nodesets.

This is intended to fix jobs that are using DevStack
without caring about the version of the nodeset image
after below change broke them:

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695114/

Change-Id: I02c46773c1f640d3d37ddcf813ed9106fbdfc67a

commit_message:
Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

pythn-vitrageclient is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

Change-Id: I6f4cc04134130a3fa36bb65492b01dff63f94e32

commit_message:
Exit running validations with a proper return code

This patch adds a proper return code management to validations running
CLI by raising an exception.

It also implement unittests for ThreadPoolExecutor.

Change-Id: Icd5075ba0526071d564c5424ced5b44a68484185
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
base: unify CentOS packages list

For infra images work we need 'base' image to be 'install_type'
agnostic. So it will be the same when built for 'binary' or 'source'
install type.

Change-Id: Ied4a00e8866560d39004a34d6857ac62e22e2c0c

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-10 14:21:18.000000000', 'message': "CentOS 8: work around mod_ssl certificate issue

All Apache httpd setup has been moved to a new helper script,
kolla_httpd_setup. This includes the existing clean of /run/httpd,
/var/run/httpd, /tmp/httpd etc.  and a new workaround for mod_ssl on
CentOS 8.

CentOS 8 has an issue with mod_ssl which produces an invalid Apache
configuration in /etc/httpd/conf.d/ssl.conf. This causes the following
error on startup:

SSLCertificateFile: file '/etc/pki/tls/certs/localhost.crt' does not exist or is empty

Work around this by generating certificates manually.

Change-Id: Ia2af74b69c151db0bd7e452460b0babcee50b282
Partially-Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-8
"}, {'created': '2019-12-10 16:44:50.000000000', 'message': "CentOS 8: work around mod_ssl certificate issue

All Apache httpd setup has been moved to a new helper script,
kolla_httpd_setup. This includes the existing clean of /run/httpd,
/var/run/httpd, /tmp/httpd etc.  and a new workaround for mod_ssl on
CentOS 8.

CentOS 8 has an issue with mod_ssl which produces an invalid Apache
configuration in /etc/httpd/conf.d/ssl.conf. This causes the following
error on startup:

SSLCertificateFile: file '/etc/pki/tls/certs/localhost.crt' does not exist or is empty

Work around this by generating certificates manually.

Change-Id: Ia2af74b69c151db0bd7e452460b0babcee50b282
Partially-Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-8
"}, {'created': '2019-12-11 11:05:51.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor Apache httpd setup

commit_message:
Refactor Apache httpd setup

All Apache httpd setup has been moved to a new helper script,
kolla_httpd_setup. This includes the existing clean of /run/httpd,
/var/run/httpd, /tmp/httpd etc.

Horizon has an additional bit of Apache config for Debian/binary, which
has been kept in extend_start.sh for horizon.

Change-Id: Ia2af74b69c151db0bd7e452460b0babcee50b282
Related: blueprint centos-rhel-8

commit_message:
Template custom HAProxy service configuration

Change Id84e3b6e62e544582d6917047534e846e026798d added support for
custom HAProxy service config using a plain copy of files in services.d.

Use a template action instead of a copy so that we can use variables and
iterate over group of hosts.

Change-Id: I1f07785932de4e4540422bd18af95241f05a67bf
(cherry picked from commit 49f334284b2b61f748c32eb434ddbb48bc9d6e59)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-12 09:57:40.000000000', 'message': 'Bump tempest_concurrency from 3 to 2 to fix race issue

Lowering down the concurrency will help services apis to complete
requests by slowing down the call and it will fix the race
condition.

Related-Bug: #1855985

Change-Id: I80fe59da05a20bceb5ebfb359da30118bed6ae07
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Bump tempest_concurrency from 3 to 2 to fix race issue

Lowering down the concurrency will help services apis to complete
requests by slowing down the call and it will fix the race
condition.

Related-Bug: #1855985

Change-Id: I80fe59da05a20bceb5ebfb359da30118bed6ae07
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Ensure PROCESS perm for sstuser on series-upgrade

This patch ensures that the PROCESS permission is added to the sstuser
user during a series upgrade from xenial to bionic.  Also patches the
README to correct some of the commands in terms of order of parameters.

Change-Id: I8ddc21e3914e3da0f64ffcedef7a6a4bb18ba4cb
Closes-Bug: #1838044

commit_message:
Fix pep8 errors found by hacking 2.0.0

Fix the following issues that are now exposed by hacking version 2.0.0

./networking_ovn/tests/unit/common/test_hash_ring_manager.py:92:38:
F602 dictionary key variable another_host_node repeated with different
values
 hash_dict_after_rebalance = {another_host_node: 'fake-uuid',

./networking_ovn/ovsdb/ovsdb_monitor.py:359:13: F841 local variable
'e' is assigned to but never used

Change-Id: If465a957a5b339ed8d1fc68b3e2ceb362cf20277
Signed-off-by: Flavio Fernandes <flaviof@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Rodolfo Alonso Hernandez <ralonsoh@redhat.com>

subject: [neutron] Adjust neighbour table thresholds
messages:
[{'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2019-09-17 14:38:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2019-09-17 14:39:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Need to investigate if this is really relevant only for neutron-l3-agent.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-09-17 15:09:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

You speak about neighbor cache, yet also modify conntrack limits there.

Default neighbor table limits are reasonable in general and they are off only for really large L2 domains - but there they are not the only problem, think about all the deadly BUM traffic. 32k hosts in a broadcast domain? I pass! :O

Though for an L3 agent connected to many networks they surely may be too small. There the size grows due to amount of networks rather than hosts in them. This also mandates higher limits for conntrack as NATting is going wild there.

Having said all that, I think L3 agent is the most applicable service that needs these adjustments.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-09-17 15:38:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This also applies to DHCP agents (sans conntrack limits) but they are usually collocated on the same hosts and short-lived cache is much less of a problem for them.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2019-10-01 15:36:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Radosław: Thanks a lot for the feedback. The increased conntrack limits were taken from the charm configuration, which they added "just in case". I am happy to take them out, as the threshold changes were sufficient in my experience to fix the issue.'}, {'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2019-11-20 20:17:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Good catch! Fixed my problems.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2019-11-27 15:33:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2019-11-28 07:14:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-12-04 14:38:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2019-12-16 08:49:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-12-16 10:02:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-12-16 11:24:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/train as commit 62db943e929093556205321a81b496d0dd8fcc5e'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-12-16 11:24:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/stein as commit 3563497a4fb44d37eaf07f4953c7b58bb14778d5'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-12-16 11:24:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit 44b9cc3b5b49d6bdbd3c59d92e8303203cab038b'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-17 14:38:55.000000000', 'message': '[neutron] Adjust neighbour table thresholds

When clouds have a large number of hosts, the default size of the ARP
cache is too small. The cache can overflow, which means that the system
has no way to reach some IP addresses.

Increasing threshold limits addresses the situation, in a reasonably
safe way (the maximum impact is 5MB or so of additional RAM used). We
also increase conntrack limits to address further potential issues.

More context on this issue:

* http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/arp.7.html
* https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-nova-compute/+bug/1780348
* https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1488938
* https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1690087
* https://github.com/crowbar/crowbar-openstack/commit/0583a0c94996df6b784229e8a534f955eaca85bc
* https://github.com/crowbar/crowbar-openstack/commit/3dd21ea62ac152e40bfdfee4b8e25a528c82a79f
* https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/1651a1805a16212299fe0a91aebb2a91ed39bc6e

Change-Id: I60c871e8eb9f2c086818ff077987f2390930800c
Closes-Bug: #1844349

commit_message:
[neutron] Adjust neighbour table thresholds

When clouds have a large number of hosts, the default size of the ARP
cache is too small. The cache can overflow, which means that the system
has no way to reach some IP addresses.

Increasing threshold limits addresses the situation, in a reasonably
safe way (the maximum impact is 5MB or so of additional RAM used).

More context on this issue:

* http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/arp.7.html
* https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-nova-compute/+bug/1780348
* https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1488938
* https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1690087
* https://github.com/crowbar/crowbar-openstack/commit/0583a0c94996df6b784229e8a534f955eaca85bc
* https://github.com/crowbar/crowbar-openstack/commit/3dd21ea62ac152e40bfdfee4b8e25a528c82a79f
* https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/1651a1805a16212299fe0a91aebb2a91ed39bc6e

Change-Id: I60c871e8eb9f2c086818ff077987f2390930800c
Closes-Bug: #1844349

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-02 14:24:12.000000000', 'message': "Stop using six library

Since we've dropped support for Python 2.7, it's time to look at
the bright future that Python 3.x will bring and stop forcing
compatibility with older versions.
This patch removes the six library from requirements, not

Change-Id: I8e2b271d0e1c4ef61b73d2e5072dc47c3276cda2

commit_message:
Stop using six library

Since we've dropped support for Python 2.7, it's time to look at
the bright future that Python 3.x will bring and stop forcing
compatibility with older versions.
This patch removes the six library from requirements, not
looking back.

Change-Id: I8e2b271d0e1c4ef61b73d2e5072dc47c3276cda2

commit_message:
CI: Use python3 for openstack clients

This switches our test jobs to use python 3 for the installation of
OpenStack clients used to test the control plane.

Change-Id: I6bf0a315cef174c42a69db3a7d57f602b27ac92c
Related: blueprint python 3

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-10 14:27:10.000000000', 'message': "Support configuration of Docker client timeout

Adds support for configuration of the Docker client timeout via
'docker_client_timeout'.

This change also increases the default timeout to 120 seconds, as we
sometimes see timeouts in CI and heavily loaded or underpowered
environments. Increasing 'docker_client_timeout' further may be helpful
in cases where Docker reports 'Read timed out'.

Change-Id: I73745771078cb2c0ebae2b1d87ba2c4c12958d82
Closes-Bug: #1809844
(cherry picked from commit 01050dc01fa8558eb453c48faa2a8efd398c5367)
"}]
commit_message:
Support configuration of Docker client timeout

Adds support for configuration of the Docker client timeout via
'docker_client_timeout'.

This change also increases the default timeout to 120 seconds, as we
sometimes see timeouts in CI and heavily loaded or underpowered
environments. Increasing 'docker_client_timeout' further may be helpful
in cases where Docker reports 'Read timed out'.

Change-Id: I73745771078cb2c0ebae2b1d87ba2c4c12958d82
Closes-Bug: #1809844
(cherry picked from commit 01050dc01fa8558eb453c48faa2a8efd398c5367)

commit_message:
Support configuration of Docker client timeout

Adds support for configuration of the Docker client timeout via
'docker_client_timeout'.

This change also increases the default timeout to 120 seconds, as we
sometimes see timeouts in CI and heavily loaded or underpowered
environments. Increasing 'docker_client_timeout' further may be helpful
in cases where Docker reports 'Read timed out'.

Change-Id: I73745771078cb2c0ebae2b1d87ba2c4c12958d82
Closes-Bug: #1809844
(cherry picked from commit 01050dc01fa8558eb453c48faa2a8efd398c5367)

commit_message:
Flesh out RevertResizeTask.rollback

This implements the TODO in the RevertResizeTask.rollback
method by logging an exception with some details and also
setting the instance to ERROR state, recording a fault
and sending an error notification, similar to the rollback
method in ConfirmResizeTask.

As noted inline, the exception message could be more detailed
but I've left that for a later change in case people want more
details.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I41296696da3226767d2bacba9345d829529ce4b6

Looks good, but will give time for stable review.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2019-12-11 16:17:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

What exactly is this "stable review" that we're giving time for? First time I've heard this mentioned. Is this a person/group? A process?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-12-11 16:30:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> What exactly is this "stable review" that we're giving time for?
 > First time I've heard this mentioned. Is this a person/group? A
 > process?

For projects that assert stables:follows-policy, there is a stable review team that (ideally) reviews things before we release. Those reviews can really happen anytime, but we've designated Monday's as the day they try to get stable release reviews done. We usually wait until Monday to let them approve. If they can't get to it, we don't want to hold things up too long, so we'll still process a release without it.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-12-12 16:22:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-12-16 10:19:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Release Octavia stable branches.

This patch proposes bugfix releases for the following stable branches:

Rocky 3.2.1
Stein 4.1.1
Train 5.0.1

Primary fixes are:
1. Better handling of issues with certificates and TLS offload.
2. Improved controller shutdown.
3. Fixed API filtering with tags and the provider capabilities list.

Change-Id: I437d2246c4dc9f8d7903227497c5bf252004dcdb

commit_message:
set selinux to permissive for image build

In RHEL8 nodepool image, selinux is set to enforcing which
cause failures as in rdocloud we run the jobs using permissive
selinux mode, enabling this flag will help to toggle the
status of selinux.

Change-Id: Ief177d2a41afdaf013efb5ab5e51c0d452487467
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

on Ubuntu, which breaks our installation of kolla-ansible on Train and
earlier stable branches.

commit_message:
CI: Set zuul's ansible_python_interpreter to python2

Train, Stein & Rocky only

Zuul seems to have started setting ansible_python_interpreter to python3
on Ubuntu, which breaks our installation of kolla-ansible on Train and
earlier stable branches.

This change sets ansible_python_interpreter explicitly to python2. We
use host-vars rather than vars because zuul sets a host-var for
ansible_python_interpreter=auto, which overrides vars.

Change-Id: I9ba0d16972b31a64617461461fafaf2b436e2bdf

commit_message:
CI: Set zuul's ansible_python_interpreter to python2

Train, Stein & Rocky only

Zuul seems to have started setting ansible_python_interpreter to python3
on Ubuntu, which breaks our installation of kolla-ansible on Train and
earlier stable branches.

This change sets ansible_python_interpreter explicitly to python2. We
use host-vars rather than vars because zuul sets a host-var for
ansible_python_interpreter=auto, which overrides vars.

Change-Id: I9ba0d16972b31a64617461461fafaf2b436e2bdf

subject: [ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Mann', 'email': 'gmann@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22623, 'name': 'Erik Olof Gunnar Andersson', 'email': 'eandersson@blizzard.com', 'username': 'eoandersson'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-11-15 03:37:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-11-15 08:16:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't agree with that goal, as I think it will be useful to be able to test python2 compatibility for patches that may get backported.

Maybe making the py2 jobs non-voting would be enough to satisfy the community goal? Otherwise I'd rather wait another cycle or two with it."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-11-15 12:11:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I don't agree with that goal, as I think it will be useful to be
 > able to test python2 compatibility for patches that may get
 > backported.
 > 
 > Maybe making the py2 jobs non-voting would be enough to satisfy the
 > community goal? Otherwise I'd rather wait another cycle or two with
 > it.

We discussed about backport and those will be modified during backport patch itself if failing on py2 (it will be very less chance). Keeping py2 jobs as n-v is no issue but those will not be able to run successfully because the dependencies like oslo etc are going to drop the py2 support."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-11-16 14:29:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-11-19 01:34:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-11-19 01:35:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

We don't have much choice here unfortunately. The CI is already broken without this."}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-11-19 08:45:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

Gross, nova.

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Designate is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693631/
Change-Id: I5a5bdc859f87f82097b95b2ebb31edb6e9b72b3a

According to sundar's advice. Will review again."}, {'account_id': 24872, 'date': '2019-11-23 10:05:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 24872, 'date': '2019-11-23 10:28:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(7 comments)

Thanks Sundar and chenke for the detailed review. Pls see my comments inline. As for the deprecation of API V1, I would like to discuss here individually.

 > v1 API was deprecated in Train and can be removed in Ussuri. My 
 > suggestion is that we don't document the details of v1 API. 
 > Instead, we can say this:
 > "Starting from Ussuri, Cyborg supports only Version 2 REST APIs. 
 > The Version 1 APIs were deprecated in Train and shall be removed in 
 > Ussuri."

The original reason why API V1 was kept as deprecated is following keystone[0] and nova [1]. I also checked the api-ref guidance page, they also have a deprecation page[2]. So IMHO we can keep it as deprecated since it complies with api-ref rules. And we don't need to pay more efforts to drop API V1.
[0]https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/
[1]https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#images-deprecated 
[2]https://docs.openstack.org/api-quick-start/#deprecated-api-versions'}, {'account_id': 24872, 'date': '2019-11-23 12:21:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Published edit on patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 24872, 'date': '2019-11-24 09:53:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 24872, 'date': '2019-11-24 11:10:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 24872, 'date': '2019-11-29 11:51:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 24872, 'date': '2019-11-29 11:57:02.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to api-ref'}, {'account_id': 24872, 'date': '2019-11-29 11:57:14.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from api-ref to (api-ref)'}, {'account_id': 24872, 'date': '2019-11-29 12:00:34.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from (api-ref) to api-ref'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-12-02 04:14:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Update api-ref: deprecate v1 add v2 device_profile section

This patch:
    1. remove api v1 section since The Version 1 APIs were deprecated in
       Train and shall be removed in Ussuri.
    2. add api v2 device_profile section
    3. other V2 apis will be added in following patches

Change-Id: I79e8adf26238a5cc6664bbef94444c59b69475fc

subject: BugFix: modify the max allocation limit of acceleration resources
messages:
[{'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-11-26 11:22:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-11-26 12:16:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-11-26 12:46:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-11-26 16:31:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I agree this is the correct thing to do.

This patch needs test coverage. Except in extreme circumstances, unit test should be a minimum criterion for acceptance of any patch. Functional testing would be ideal, but I understand if you don't have the framework for that yet.

I would also suggest taking this opportunity to refactor and simplify _gen_resource_inventory, which provides little value as it stands. Since it's only used one way in one code path (albeit twice) you could embed the max==total logic in the method itself and get rid of the unnecessary kwargs and explicit defaults, e.g.:

 def _gen_resource_inventory(name, total):
     # reserved, min_unit, step_size, and allocation_ratio get sane defaults from placement
     return {name: {
         'total': total,
         'max_unit': total,
     }}

That's just a suggestion, but it'll reduce your unit test surface, which is significant given that you'll be building it from scratch.

To be clear, the fix is correct; the -1 is for lack of test coverage."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-11-26 16:32:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

By the way, the default max_unit in placement is MAX_INT, which would work fine for your purposes, since scheduling will be limited by `total` anyway. So you could just omit it from the inventory dict and make this even simpler.'}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-11-27 02:45:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I agree this is the correct thing to do.
 > 
 > This patch needs test coverage. Except in extreme circumstances,
 > unit test should be a minimum criterion for acceptance of any
 > patch. Functional testing would be ideal, but I understand if you
 > don't have the framework for that yet.
 > 
 > I would also suggest taking this opportunity to refactor and
 > simplify _gen_resource_inventory, which provides little value as it
 > stands. Since it's only used one way in one code path (albeit
 > twice) you could embed the max==total logic in the method itself
 > and get rid of the unnecessary kwargs and explicit defaults, e.g.:
 > 
 > def _gen_resource_inventory(name, total):
 > # reserved, min_unit, step_size, and allocation_ratio get sane
 > defaults from placement
 > return {name: {
 > 'total': total,
 > 'max_unit': total,
 > }}
 > 
 > That's just a suggestion, but it'll reduce your unit test surface,
 > which is significant given that you'll be building it from scratch.
 > 
 > To be clear, the fix is correct; the -1 is for lack of test
 > coverage.

Thanks Eric. I agree with you. Unit tests are necessary. But currently there is no unit test for the entire cyborg/conductor directory. In the discussion of ptg, we put unit testing at a relatively high priority, and I believe it will be better soon.
Agree, we just need to set total."}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-11-27 03:03:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> By the way, the default max_unit in placement is MAX_INT, which
 > would work fine for your purposes, since scheduling will be limited
 > by `total` anyway. So you could just omit it from the inventory
 > dict and make this even simpler.

Because this patch is for bugfix. About the refactor, I will use a new patch for this. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-11-27 19:07:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

This change LGTM.

 > Because this patch is for bugfix. About the refactor, I will use a
 > new patch for this.

Hi Chenke, generally UT goes with the patch. If you prefer to add a separate patch for conductor UT (since there is much to do there), please add it as a patch series on top of this one. Then we can review both together.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-11-27 19:36:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I worked up the refactor in a patch on top of this one [1]. It includes introducing the test suite for conductor/manager.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/696393/'}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-11-28 01:54:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> I worked up the refactor in a patch on top of this one [1]. It
 > includes introducing the test suite for conductor/manager.
 > 
 > [1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/696393/

Thanks to Eric for helping us put cond/manager UT work.'}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-12-15 06:18:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-12-15 08:58:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-12-15 09:03:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

 > separate patch for conductor UT (since there is much to do there),

 > review both together.

Thanks. Done.'}, {'account_id': 25738, 'date': '2019-12-16 05:40:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-26 11:22:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix report the max limit of acceleration resources to the placement

The max unit of acceleration resources should be set to maximum

commit_message:
BugFix: modify the max allocation limit of acceleration resources

The max unit of acceleration resources should be set to maximum
instead of min(1).

like nova:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/9316976946c04573bbd18128bbb0674937c4eaf1/nova/virt/hyperv/hostops.py#L265

For the reason, pls see the Story.

The UT for this patch in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/696393.

Story: 2006947

Change-Id: I0aac84a1fc6b00b5523927bee27f7491daecd786

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

specs repo has py2 specific requirement which is removed
or tox optimization.

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I4544d8d1192539d50bca836f6699261658ae38ed

commit_message:
Start README.rst with a better title

Now that we are using gitea the contents of our README.rst are
more prominently displayed. Starting it with a "Team and repository
tags" title is a bit confusing. This change makes it start with the
name of the project instead.

Change-Id: Ib93d9c5f08f5a82cfdf615b676879d1aa95a8db2

I want to take another look (wondering if this has any devstack implications).  Some suggested revisions inline.  (The release note could be updated as a follow-up patch.)'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-12-12 21:50:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I looked through devstack, looks like everything uses the tls-proxy for ssl termination, so this should be OK.  I put up a devstack patch depending on this change so we can see what happens:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/698811/

Also noticed that devstack still has support for the v1 API, so I put up a patch to remove that: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/698808/'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-12-13 02:16:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

tempest-full-py3 failed with this change on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/698811/ ... have not had time to determine whether it's a real or spurious failure.

Also, I just noticed that https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695707/ has not merged yet.  I just rebased it.  We need that to get all the tips jobs running on py3."}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2019-12-13 12:28:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-12-13 14:18:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

Another option would be to rely on the version of this in oslo.service instead. It's still broken on py3, but I guess everything could be... broken... together that way. Given that there's no more py2 releases and it's very unlikely that eventlet ever gets fixed, I think this is fine though."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-12-13 14:24:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

Looks like that devstack patch tempest failure on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/698811/ was spurious.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-12-13 14:25:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I think we should wait to merge this just in case the tests on that devstack weren't as thorough as I thought they were, because this change has the potential to break the gate.

I propose that Abhishek +W it when he comes in to work on Monday morning, and that way between Erno, me, and Sean, we'll have people available to revert the change in the worst case."}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-12-16 04:30:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Remove native ssl support

As eventlet ssl termination is broken with python 3 and
we won't be supporting python 2.7 anymore we will just
remove ssl termination to glance-api and expect the
termination being handled by something else, like HAProxy.

This patch also removes the broken ssl test job as the
non-existing feature is not broken anymore.

Change-Id: Iaf16dfcfdb3a2c93312dcad1ea1229e6b3c8caaa

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

python-cyborgclient is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: If4ed97647cb82d373addabb9382589d6da20ed1a

commit_message:
Support log tail/save for instance

Support to show log content and save instance log files:

  openstack database log tail [--lines LINES] <instance> <log_name>
  openstack database log save [--file FILE] <instance> <log_name>

Change-Id: I2a4eecca663f9126f770fae4c4be28b3667f91c4

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-20 17:43:49.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ia9cca011e563363381167a6c4afd402d52f8e828
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ia9cca011e563363381167a6c4afd402d52f8e828

commit_message:
Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

python-troveclient is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

Change-Id: I425cb0d2f1487819fde9ebae46fe3570b72cbe88

Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

python-watcherclient is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-02 11:10:54.000000000', 'message': 'Add procname for uwsgi based service cyborg-api

Code in grenade and elsewhere rely on the process/service name
when one runs "ps auxw" and they grep for example "grep -e cyborg-api"
to check if the service is running. with uwsgi, let us make sure
we use process name prefix so it is easier to spot the services
and be compatible with code elsewhere that relies on this.

Reference:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/494531/

Change-Id: I7afa389160d3a2355e7a077fec2570423254c83d
'}]
commit_message:
Add procname for uwsgi based service cyborg-api

Code in grenade and elsewhere rely on the process/service name
when one runs "ps auxw" and they grep for example "grep -e cyborg-api"
to check if the service is running. with uwsgi, let us make sure
we use process name prefix so it is easier to spot the services
and be compatible with code elsewhere that relies on this.

Reference:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/494531/

Change-Id: I7afa389160d3a2355e7a077fec2570423254c83d

commit_message:

Train was the last release supporting python2. Let's rip the bandaid
off.

This job should be done between R-22 and R-13.

Reference:
[1]. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691365
[2]. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/688593

subject: Fix nginx getting OOM killed
messages: [{'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-12-13 22:42:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-12-15 20:58:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-12-16 00:36:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-13 22:42:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix nginx getting OOM killed

* Set requests.memory=256MiB  for the nginx-ingress-controller pod
We decided to leave limits open as this will allow to support most
of the generic use cases.
* QoS from Guaranteed to Burstable
This will make that application and ingress starve each other,
both fighting for node resources for an optimal usage of CPU
* Set priority class so that pods can take priority on a node that
might have No CPU taint.

task: 37625
story: 2006945

Change-Id: Ibc77ea64ad47f1a400d040f419f38bf52b9f0141
Signed-off-by: Diogo Guerra <diogo.filipe.tomas.guerra@cern.ch>
(cherry picked from commit e75e28dcbf2c6281e175fbe05217712e8e879a01)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix nginx getting OOM killed

* Set requests.memory=256MiB  for the nginx-ingress-controller pod
We decided to leave limits open as this will allow to support most
of the generic use cases.
* QoS from Guaranteed to Burstable
This will make that application and ingress starve each other,
both fighting for node resources for an optimal usage of CPU
* Set priority class so that pods can take priority on a node that
might have No CPU taint.

task: 37625
story: 2006945

Change-Id: Ibc77ea64ad47f1a400d040f419f38bf52b9f0141
Signed-off-by: Diogo Guerra <diogo.filipe.tomas.guerra@cern.ch>
(cherry picked from commit e75e28dcbf2c6281e175fbe05217712e8e879a01)

commit_message:
Update bindep for RHEL/CentOS 8

Install policycoreutils-python in RHEL/CentOS 7.
Install policycoreutils-python-utils in Fedora and RHEL/CentOS 8.

This patch also drops python3-setuptools from bindep as Fedora 28 is
EOL and RPM dependency is fixed in >= Fedora 29.

Change-Id: I0ecd29e0f113005d7e993add84d2c4fb90fd16e3

commit_message:
Create a controller for qga when SEV is used

When a guest agent is requested, it requires a virtio-serial controller.
If the controller is not created explicitly, it will be created by
libvirt. But if AMD SEV is also requested, the controller is expected
to use the iommu driver.

In order to achive that, the controller is created explicitly with the
required driver.

Change-Id: I47c248649b9d77e8bd7c5350fc84d89342be4623
Closes-Bug: 1845986
(cherry picked from commit c2fd8294fdb615d5229c4eb2abef1226b7cc580b)
